0, 2015
												Damn I wanted to like this so much. As an avid follower of F1 and a racing game enthusiast, I had some hopes in the new physics and their work in FFB... But it shouldn't be.After playint time trial in a Ferrari F15-T on Silverstone using a Logitech G27, I can say the following:-FFB feels atrocious. No info. No feeling of load on any axle. No feel for grip loss. It vibrates when you are off-track though.-Codemasters seem to have trouble mastering steering wheels. Even selecting the correct preset, the rotation of the ingame-wheel and the real wheel are not locked. You can fix this by limiting the range of your wheel, but it just gives me a bad first impression. Other games do this so much better, for example project CARS or assetto corsa.-The physics are hard to judge with that force feedback. But good luck trying not to lock up when you can't feel a thing. It's a guessing game. The only indicator for lockups is a high-pitched, very loud tyre squeal.+/-The graphics are ok. The screen on the wheel is generic, gives very little info, the textures of the driver gloves are muddy and generally it just doesn't scream "beautiful". But the graphics are good enough+The sound of the engine sounds goodAfter only 11 minutes of playing, the game doesn't fascinate me enough to continue playing. I am debating whether to get a refund.I do NOT recommend this game to wheel users at all

content:
2, 2015
												F1 Race Stars is a better Formula 1 game than this......I have been a fan of Codmasters F1 and Dirt series games since the first release. I preordered this game with the information that I read over the internet from reviewers and from the Codies website. I also used my previous experience with Codmasters F1 games as a basis on what type of quality to expect from a game like this one. I have previously purchased Dirt, Dirt 2, Dirt 3, F1 2010 thru 2014 from Steam and for the most part was happy with my purchase. I am also a fan of other racing titles that are more sim than game such as IRacing, Project cars. I have enjoyed playing Race 07, Asetto Corsa except the game server on Asetto Coursa is a joke. I spent many hours in Papyrus titles like GPL and their Nascar series , and also on Geoff Crammonds World Circuit thru his GP4. I have seen both the good and bad of all these titles at their best and worst. I did not set my expectations for F1 2015 any higher than what I had seen them previously release.Common sense would dictate that a company that has been making F1 games for the PC since their September release in 2010 would have a good handle on what it takes to get a game ready to market. Common sense need not apply here. It seems with the release of F1 2015 Codmasters has indeed returned to it's roots......console gaming. This title was written with that customer in mind, once again letting the PC customer know their business was unimportant to Codemasters.The control menus are a bad joke with the PC customer being the punchline. I was never able to get both my CSW V2 wheel and Richmotech real race gear pedals to work at the same time. It is a game that really does not have a target audience and does not know where to fit in. It is neither a Sim for hardcore enthuiasts or an arcade game strictly for fun. It lacks the features needed to entice the player into the simulated world of F1 Racing. This game is like a bad coat of paint aimed squarely at oblivion and doesn't really cover up all the problems underneath. With a shameful lack of content considering what was in previous releases, there is No fuunctional safety car, No  TV interviews, No career mode, No co-op mode, No Classic F1 cars,  No season challenge, No rival system, No champions mode, No SLI support, No split screen, No motorhome. No paddock and No TV interviews. The sheer scarcity of options and modes means this is yet another year where the "Official F1 tie-in" never even gets to the starting grid. The amount of modes left out of this title is borderline criminal and scandalous. It feels like less than half a game was released at a premium price no less. This title is far inferior to 2014, which was in turn inferior to the 2013 release. I don't believe most buyers will believe this is a "less is more" situation, but rather a trend to charge more and give less. They "throw in" the 2014 season as a bonus, because it's obvious they intend to BONE US with this title and the absense of so much of what should be seen as standard for F1. Codemasters really should kiss you before you buy this game, since it seems their intent is to just screw you, perhaps you would feel less used after. This publisher is so hell bent on hitting it's yearly release schedule that it pulled this one out of the oven half baked, and a easy bake oven they got a at a garage sale at that.I run a high end system and love to see titles push that hardware for what its worth. My current rig features  a core !7-5960, 64 gb ddr4, (2) Titan X video cards in SLI, 2 ASUS G-sync 27" monitors at a res of  5890 x 1080 bezel corrected @144 hz. Aparently I would have had better results on a console system with this title. It crashed the first few times I ran a benchmark test so bad I needed to reload my video drivers and recalibrate the monitors as this game had them stuck in limbo after multiple crashes. This game crashes more than Maldonado and Grosjean combined. The graphics looked bad even when I got them to display, but they were constantly blinking and flashing, seemingly fishing for a proper state of display this catastrophy of a game could not deliver. It looked like it was snowing in Singapore and it nearly caused me to have suffer a seizure from the constant screen blinking. Because I never was ablle to get my wheel and pedals working at the same time, even though they worked fine in all their previous titles, I can not comment on the physics. The track textures have a filtery feeling that left me nausiated as well. This game is so awkwardly stylized it's more like a bad cartoon Anime, than a racing title.I would have to say that after a few hours of utter frustration spent trying to fix all the problems that run rampant with simple setup of this game, that the quit menu works great and that's about all. But even that suffers from problems as Steam then tries desperately to download some sort of non-existent update and finishes on an error 41. I suggest we all quit buying these type of half baked mess and let Codemasters know it no excuses as it is not their first rodeo, but could be their last. The best thing to do with this game is delete it permantly from your drive. There are plenty of good titles that offer proper racing that works to deal with this junk. Return it and get a refund while you can. Don't let them pull the wool over your eyes with idle promises to fix it....baaaahhhh bahhhhh.In a side note to STEAM, shame on you too. I have been a customer for over 8 years and have never even tried to return a title. I tried multiple times to get a refund on this as I was never able to complete even one lap, but was told that beacause I had more than 2 hours of trying to fix this worthless piece of junk, that they would not refund my money. Instead opting to join their co-conspirator Codmasters in ripping of a loyal customer for short term profit. Shame on you STEAM and Codmasters, I have purchased many of your products and recommended them to my friends, alas my policy is changed on that too. I will NEVER pre purchase a title again with this return policy. I had always believed that STEAM treated their customers fairly and with respect, but I see this was yet another lesson learned from this terible gaming experience.Your money would be much better spent on the 2012 or 2013 Codemasters F1 games than this abortion of a game. I would recommend Project Cars or IRacing to anyone looking for a Racing Sim.Had either of those titles offered all the cars or tracks from the current F1 season I would have never bothered with this lackluster castrophy in the first place. Save your money and buy something else.

content:
9, 2016
												An honest review from a long-time Codies and F1 fan:Let me start by saying I don't play multiplayer often so this review has nothing to do with that section of the game.Having until now held back from purchasing this game due to the lack of career mode and the discussions of game-breaking bugs and crap AI, I can honestly say I was surprised at how not-broken this game really is. - Is it clearly a rushed job in terms of menus and extra content (i.e. challenge modes) from previous titles? Yes. - Is it a shame that there's only a 'championship season' mode rather than career? Yes, hugely!However, this game is NOT broken. Sure, there are some optimisation issues that mean that I can't run it on ultra, whereas my machine specs might otherwise have allowed it. But it looks very pretty on 'high' settings--far better than any F1 game has looked by far. Furthermore, since the modes are kind of bare-bones, the most important aspect of the entire game has to be the car mechanics and the racing. The mechanics themselves, while not perfect, feel really nice. This is NOT an arcade F1 game: with assists off you're fighting your back end out of the corners and trying to manage fuel/tyres in a way never before achieved in an F1 game. There's improvement to be made, but it's heading in a really great direction for F1 2016. For those really into the technical stuff, adjusting brake-bias and other settings are far more important now when it comes to preventing tyre lock-ups that now actually will destroy individual tyres. The AI is pretty dumb at times, admittedly. But it isn't game breaking (perhaps it was fixed over time).  But if you're like me and you were an F1 fan itching for F1 2016, hesitating to buy this one or having completely written it off, with the discount it's a really good buy. It is no longer a broken game as many reviews will tell you and it's actually a lot of fun. It's not the F1 2015 we were all hoping for, without career mode. But they focused on the racing, the feel of the cars, and they've done that really well. To tide you over until 2016 is released in August, I would definitely recommend this. More casual racing fans ought to stay away and wait until 2016 which will undoubtedly be better and more polished.Overall: 7/10 If it had career mode and some AI fixes it'd easily be a 9. As a result, buy it when on sale.

content:
0, 2015
												A crying shame of a product.Before I start, let me say I've by no means had the worst of this: the game runs fairly well for me, I've experienced far fewer crashes than some others, and I actually can maintain a just-about-playable 30-35 FPS (though with micro-stuttering).F1 2015 was touted as the start of the 'next series' of F1 games, with improved visuals and handling (both of which are, indeed, present).  However, it's fairly clear to see why there was very little media coverage of the game prior to launch: a huge swathe of features present in the 2010-2014 iterations of the title simply aren't there (no safety car, no brake options in setup, no career mode, etc.) and even some of the promised features don't function yet on PC (voice-activated race engineer, for example).  The omission of career mode doesn't really bother me greatly, though it was a nice feature, but removing the safety car in an F1 season where it's seen a significant amount of action, seems incredibly short-sighted.Add to this a game that crashes frequently; fails to remember options set in menus; has AI who drive like you're not even there (ramming you from behind or aggressively swerving into one of your rear tyres, usually resulting in a penalty for you); and displays a horrendous impermeable "blur" past about 200m in front of the car, that makes it almost impossible to see braking points and fine details in the distance... and you have a disappointing product.Many wondered how the system requirements for the game could be so high, in the face of a comparatively stripped-down F1 experience, and we have our answer: graphical optimisation seems almost non-existant.  The difference between "everything on ultra" and "everything on low/off" on my machine, represents a whopping 5 FPS difference (from ~30 FPS to ~35 FPS)... leaving us to assume there's a serious bottleneck occurring somewhere, that apparently wasn't worth finding before asking customers to hand over their hard-earned £40.Amongst all of this, however, it has to be said: the handling model has improved significantly in most of the major areas, and you do feel significantly less 'helpless' than in previous F1 titles by Codemasters (which infamously included the mind-bogglingly stupid "auto-spin kerbs").  I've been enjoying the driving experience, until the blur and micro-stuttering gives me a headache and I have to give it a break for an hour or two :)Not as bad of a screw-up as Arkham Knight, but certainly worthy of being mentioned in the same sentence - a spectacularly poor attempt from Codemasters and, if I hadn't purchased from a third-party, I'd be half way to my Steam refund by now.

content:
0, 2015
												CAUTION: DUE TO THE STATE OF THIS GAME, THIS REVIEW IS SUBJECT TO CHANGEOkay, so Codemasters have really confused me with this one. Their F1 series, while generally good (2013 being their best effort, at least for me), has always lacked that little bit of magic to truly set it apart from previous, and quite frankly, better F1 games.F1 2015 had the opportunity to really set a new standard for the genre, with Codemasters finally taking the hint and using the power of next generation gaming platforms to build a newer, more modern engine.What followed is a product that has ultimately both satisfied and disappointed me for various reasons. Here we go.PROS- The handling model. Yes. Finally. I can't believe it. Codies have actually managed to produce cars which drive and feel great. And not in the "easy" sense of things. Turn the aids off, and you will struggle for traction, you will pump the brakes to keep them from locking, and you will need lightning reactions to correct over/understeer and avoid damaging your car and tyres. The feedback provided through the wheel is great, and you almost instantly know you've taken a corner well, even with your eyes shut. It truly is satisfying when you really nail a corner, let alone a whole lap.- The Presentation. One thing Codies Racing fans have been asking for since 2010 is a more TV-styled game, and this year they finally deliver. The often talked about Broadcast Presentation before and after races is great, with TV style camera angles and OSDs that come close to the FOM world feed. The commentary is awesome too, with lots and lots of varied lines, you don't really hear much of the same thing, and it just gels. It doesn't sound robotic and mis-matched like previous attempts at putting commentary in an F1 game. (I'm looking at YOU, Championship Edition.)And that's about it, I'm afraid. All that I really enjoy about this game. Those two points. I'm serious. Really.Here's a quick mish-mash of all the cons then:CONS- Codemasters giveth, and they doth taketh away. Want to race as yourself? Too bad. It's gone. Want to race with equal setups in Time Attack to truly find who is the best? Shame, that's gone too. Safety Car? Gone. Season Challenge? Gone. Scenario Mode...you get the idea.- The game doesn't seem to save my preferences and I find myself having to redo custom controls every I boot up.- Online Multiplayer. No. Just no.- Then there's the numerous bugs and glitches truly representative of an unfinished game. Just type in F1 2015 glitches/bugs in Youtube and you'll pretty much get what I mean.- Codies' amazing idea to pad out the game with 2014 content and hope no-one notices.It's a shame that, while Codemasters finally got something amazingly right in F1 2015, there are too many places where they just fall flat on their faces. I really don't know if I can review this as Recommended. I guess if the improved handling model is all you ever wanted, then it's great. Have a blast. However, if you were looking forward to a more comprehensive game with more appeal beyond just a World Championship Season, then just stick with F1 2013, it really is still the best.

												It's not a bad game at all actually. I played all games since F1 2010 to date, so have some experience in "Codemasters" thoughts of semi-simulations.What is missing in F1 2015 game is just "Carrer mode" and maybe some challenges, as we had in previous releases.I'm not interested in multiplayer, because there's lack of players in racing games anyway, so I don't bother. Since you're in single player mode - you have quite a good challenge from improved AI.PRO Season mode is something that I was unable to compete in, since I have only XBOX controller. PRO Season mode - tough challenge, no aids, legend competition, no visual guides, so you must be prepared for it. Anyway, I'm not an expert in game reviews, but this game is not a bad game, as most of community claims.+ Graphics+ Physics+ Improved AI+ Challenging Steam achivements+ Incl. 2014 season- No Carrer mode- No single player challenges- Lack of players in multiplayer

number of helpful: 19 of 29 people (66%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
1, 2015
												First i'll start with positive aspects of this game since there is not too much to say about this.Positives:-The new thing that I liked the most and you could only do it in the old F1 2006 is that you can spectate any racer from the pit during Practice/Qualifications. (Yes, with any pov and anyone)-I found all of the tracks better, in therm of graphics, if your specs are the one recommended or above then you will not have FPS drops playing at Ultra quality.-You can talk to your engineer while racing, it works with a mic, you can ask anything along the race, I did not expect this.-AI is more aggressive than previous games, and will try to overtake you in a corner or off the racing line. (Which causes crashes in most of the case, but it's still better than before.)That's all I found with the positives, now you'll understand why I rated this game that way.Negatives:-This game is unplayable with Keyboard , you need to have a Joystick otherwise you will just race off the track at every corner. So I took my Gamepad to try my best.-Gameplay changed too much, car handling is not perfect nothing near a real simulation. -AI is stupid (even more than previous games) and will drive into you, or will randomly ghost when you try to overtake them.-No more Safety car, no more Career Mode (I played only Career mode in their old games and I guess many did the same)-Collisions/Car damage is not realistic at all, as always we will need to wait until modders fix this, since CodeMasters will probably not.-The game gave me the worst corner cutting experience i've ever had. No jokes, even in F1 2006, 2010, 2013, 2014, it was more realistic when turning into corners. It just feels like the wheel does not turn but the car keeps turning like everything is fine.Well that's all I got to say, now if you're looking for an Arcade game then this is made for you, if you're looking for a true F1 experience (as they advertised) then you will be disappointed as Car handling even with all assists off is too unstable, no career mode and no safety car which is totally unrealistic.As they always do, they won't add anything until F1 2016 so they can get our money again just for 2-3 new features. That got me bored. Having new features that are cool but in the meantime they remove things that F*cks up the game.Next time i'll try it at a friend's house before giving away my money.

												Pros:- The visuals and sounds of the car are really beautiful, a huge step up from 2014- Pitting is a lot realistic in release time and wheel changing- Car handling is very good with controller but would be nice if there was a tweak feature like project car doesCons:- Lack of co-op feature although I don't do co-op I love watching other people do races on YouTube so this is a huge let down- AI all over the place and bumping into your car even though you're driving in a straight line. They will try to overtake but really love to hit your rear wheels and make you spin off track or into a wall. (Had to do 5 laps with Maldonado and Grosjean on my rear and can't count the amount of times I had to use flashbacks to correct the crashes they made me do)- This motion blur effect when pitting is weird as when you turn into your pit station it looks like the game is lagging pretty badly.- Championship mode lacks features of customising how you want your race weekend to go. Some people have a lot of time while others don't and just want to get into the race. Speeding up the time is very slow and would be nice to add a feature that can increase the time in steps.All in all the game can be good but I wouldn't recommend buying the game till all the problems have been resolved. Also the lack of features in the game the price should be no more than £20. Luckily I got mine for £27.99 on Amazon prime so I did save quite a bit than paying £39.99 but still I feel I paid more than what I should have.

												1. There is horrible microstutter which makes the game look jittery and choppy even when locked at 60 frames per second. Without vsync my system pushes around 90fps on the High preset - it still doesn't look smooth at all.2. The graphics are insanely blurry.3. Fanatec Clubsport V2 pedals are not properly supported, there is a massive unadjustable deadzone that means only a tiny amount of the brake pedal's movement actually has any effect in game. It is virtually impossible to brake like this, tapping the brakes doesn't work because the game doesn't detect anything while braking hard is an instant lock up because the range detected in game is so small I can basically only brake 100% or not at all. (It is not my pedals, they work fine in every other game including previous F1 games and there are reports of other people with the exact same issue).4. The game crashes every time on exit.5. Loading times are outrageously long.6. Why are the AA options so limited? TAA is atrocious and SMAA doesn't do much for the jaggies.I can't comment on the AI because I haven't raced against them seeing as the lack of support for my pedals makes the game unplayable.

content:
2, 2015
												Honestly, the game is a challenge to get used to - I'm not disputing that at all. It's good to have a challenge. However, there are too many other problems with the game that are just too big to ignore. Predominantely:- Graphics: While they are good, Codies have gone from looks over actual gameplay and functionality.- Multiplayer: is absolutely woeful. It's impossible to race against anyone effectively when the game can't keep up with who is where on the track. All of a sudden, you get told you're in first, and before you even cross the line, someone else has crossed it and pops up a fastest lap.- Push to Talk: Why was this stripped out of the game? I don't want to voice everyone in the game if I'm speaking to someone privately in a TS Server.- Glitches: ie: refer my posted screen shot - how the hell can a car drive around on rims!?!?!? This isn't the only one.- Gameplay assists: There's absolutely NO difference between Traction Control being off and on Medium. There was at least some difference on 2014.- Steam Achievements and Trading Cards: Despite doing at least 10 clean laps around Russia in a Marrusia in Time Trial, the game fails to recognise these laps towards the achievement - I don't know why. The game also claims to have Steam Trading cards - I'm yet to see any after nearly 4 hours of play, and a friend has 10 times as many hours (40) and hasn't seen any either. So the Trading Cards are a blatant lie at this stage.Codies - if you bothered to look at the Meta Scores in Steam for your games since 2010, they have been steadilly declining, with 2014 being the worst of the last 5. Your track record suggests that this one will be the worst of the lot. If you can't get your ♥♥♥♥ together, you don't deserve a renewal to make more of these games from FOM.There's just one question remaining: Did anyone at Codemasters even bother to test this game PROPERLY before it was released?**EDIT: SInce my review, allegedly, trading cards have been released. **

content:
0, 2015
												I can't reccomend the game in it's current state as it doesn't support controllers properly.I first tried using a DualShcok 4 through DS4Windows, but that made the camera flick erratically between different angles constantly, making the game unplayable.I then switched to a Logitech F510 (an offically-supported PC gamepad), and the game doesn't work properly with that either. In DirectInput mode, the game thinks the X button is the B button, the A button is the B button and so on. It also locks the brakes on as soon as you start a session, so again unplayable.I tried the pad in the archaic XInput mode, and while the game does seem to recognise it as a gamepad, the R2 and L2 buttons in XInput mode work like switches rather than triggers, so you're throttle and brakes are either 0% on or 100% on, with no middle ground. This also makes the cars completely undriveable, and the game unplayable.There's absolutely NO excuse for selling a game with such fundamental playing errors. At the moment, you can't even call it a game, because you can't play it AT ALL. I don't know if CodeMasters have left the PC port 'til the last minute, or don't think that controller support is necessary for their games, or if they were forced to release the game in such a state to satisfy contractual demands with the Formula 1 licensing body, but whatever the reason, they've royally screwed over their fans and their customers.I cannot reccomend this game to anyone.

content:
18, 2016
												Seriosuly, Codemasters couldn't be bothered to support a Thrustmaster GTX controller? It's kind of shocking since there is that whole Codemasters-Thrustmaster partnership thing and they support EIGHTEEN other Thrustmaster products. That is litteraly half of the PC enable devices listed on the Codemaster website, so it's not like this is some weird no-name 3rd party controller that no one knows about. Hell, I bought this controller specifically because it was the best rated controller for racing style games and I can't really afford to shell out an extra $300 on a wheel and pedal setup as nice as that would be. Even after going into the settings menu I couldn't even create a custom profile and bind the controller buttons, even though it seemed like the option to do so was there. I can't really discuss the gameplay because I couldn't actually get to play the game at all. I am hugely dissapointed that Codemasters couldn't be bothered to add in suppoort for what is basically a standard 360 gamepad. Oh, the graphics of the cars are ok but everything else (track, stands, etc.) looks like it was assembled out of 2005's leftovers. Two thumbs way, way down.

number of helpful: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful
content:
5, 2015
												For ♥♥♥♥'s sake Codemasters I knew there was a high posibility of not delivering much inovation to the series, but you seriously gave the gamers a ♥♥♥♥ing downgraded game! I mean how more could you ♥♥♥♥ this up? I think you can't be more dissapointed since your expectations are so low. How on earth can you give your customers a product such as F1 2015? And I am not even mentioning the bugs that come with the game (which luckily did not occure to me)!Since I started with a negatively very bad introduction I'll try to talk about the pros. First of all the number one thing I was desprately waiting for was the inprovment of the AI cars. This year i could finally say the AI  cars are a challenge and gives the game a tromendous amount of depth which makes the races attractive in so many levels compared to the previous F1 games from Codies, but it took them 5 years to improve such a basic gameplay tool that should be a priority in every racing game! And ladies and gentlemen that's about it when it comes to gameplay improvment.There is also an improvment in the graphics and it's nice to see a visual difference in F1 2015 and previous F1 games. I could insist it looks next gen, but isn't mind blowing. Now the cons: It seemed to me that the developers were mostly interested in the graphic upgrade like better looking environments, faces and the engineers ,which is completely pointless since all of the character models are acting the same just like in other pre-race start. It definitely does not make my Formula 1 experience more authentic regardlessly on how much the graphics are in depth of detail. If I get to see the same ♥♥♥♥ over and over again it just gets annoying (same thing about the comentary). I'd rather just have a simple menu were I could use my imagination instead of forcing my self to enjoy something  I'm used to see a lot of amount of times. Some drivers do look pretty neat and some do look literally disgusting like for example Maldonado.The worst thing about this game is the missing content. At first I was amazed by it, but after trying to play a different single player mode instead of just playing quick race, champions mode or time trail I started to realize there is nothing really else to do in this game, but wait you say there is multiplayer? Well i say multiplayer is pure ♥♥♥♥. I spent a week playing this game and I could not even once find a multiplayer session. Codemasters won't let you even create an open lobby session, You can only play with your freinds, but if you wanna race with the rest of the world you can use their "innovative" multiplayer modes which don't have a single player in it!And the last thing I would like to mention is one of the important aspect of the game that has a big part on how the game runs is the LACK OF SAFETY CAR. I have simply no words for not including such an important game feature that was in the previous games. You say it will be patched sooner or later? That makes it look like that the game is still in early access alpha god damn it!When it comes to gameplay features this game is definety fun, but this innovative feature of the game cannot save it from the overall lack of content.6/10

content:
y 3, 2016
												Why i feel ripped off.1. This game is poorly optimised and will have fps issues even on really good pcs. 2. This game crashes - a lot! In games with 1 lap to go it can crash on you, and often it crashes on startup.3. Stearing does not feel as smooth as in 2013. - there is some latency on controllers! watch out.4. Game doesn't feel finished at all. I feel like im playing an alpha version of the game - i played 40 euro for this!!5. Its really hard to find multiplayer games.Pros.1. Graphics look good - on the right setup2. Better AI's3. Awesome music!EDIT:After 20 hours of gameplay i decided to play the game with a steering wheel, and oh my, --- its a completely different experience. Recommended IF you are using steering wheel with force feedback.If you are using a controller or have an old pc, buy f1 2013

number of helpful: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful
content:
0, 2015
												Absolute Garbage.I have watched and loved f1 since 1994 and played the games since 1995.  F1 97 is still more enjoyable than this effort from these money grabbing goons.  Hang your heads in shame, Codemasters!The PC version should look absolutely stunning now that the consoles versions are "next gen" but somehow it looks worse than last year in some areas.  The handling is quite nice once you get a feel for it but the braking is very unpredictable and you can't trail brake like you would in PCars/Corsa/Iracing etc.There seems to be a new glitch every 30s.  If you use a flashback from terminal damage the game will continue to run in black and white once you have continued.  You seem to get constantly kicked from online lobbys just as the race is about to begin.  Online there is a gearbox bug that means you are always in the limiter no matter what gear you  use.  As with previous games you need to use vsync for your wheel to work properly.  If you decide to restart a race it will put you in neutral.  To top it all off you will constantly be kicked back to your desktop. Well done.

number of helpful: 9 of 13 people (69%) found this review helpful
content:
0, 2015
												EDIT :31rd December 2016. Dont get this piece of ♥♥♥♥.. just dont. Even the controls are still ♥♥♥♥ed. Back in the days, you could at least manually assign controls so it'd work, but now, controller, or KB, doest matter. will just get stuck on full throttle. cant change ♥♥♥♥ in options. Just dont get it. Maybe if its 1€ but other than that,dont trust it to actually work.What can i say, the game is great, but lacking in so many ways, and i wish steam had a Neutral rating aswell.First off lets start with the positives.The handling model really seems to be upgraded, and i really enjoy the racing. way more than before!AI is okay, more agressive than before, and faster!Pro mode is a good concept. (More on that later though.)Driving in rain is fairly good looking with offset TVPod. And actually in general.The engineer stuff is pretty immersive, and he will update you aswell with info etc.Tyre wear seems great so far and you can really feel your grip go, and feel if you are hard on them or not.Game seems to run well, and stable maxed out. 4690k / 970.Negatives.Stripped features, that were in previous games like :No Scenario mode.No Co-Op season.No career mode.Full qualifying but 50% race? nope.It feels bareboned at best sadly.Raindrops on your screen is worse than f1 2014. Very blurry, can barely tell its supposed to be drops.Lackluster settings, like chromatic abberation and blur having to be manually killed off in the config.Come on codemasters, Windows 8 has voice recognition aswell, you COULD have added that feature for PC aswell.Pro mode is manual gears only, and i feel that isn't really okay. We should still have the option of manual/auto.Tire models seem almost too clean? Grass to rubber transition is instant instead of wearing off slowly etc.Multiplayer not finding any games for me /will be edited out when it does.Multiplay lobbies are friends only , right now it seems.Game is beautiful, but doesn't look like the next gen stuff from the trailers.If they are going to add Podium cutscenes, at least pull them off right, the funny music is extremely anti climactic, and no champagne spraying etc.Drivers hugging /Arm around the shoulders... LOL.FFB.I'm very sad, because i really wanted to give it a good review, but as of right now, it's not going to get one, Next gen game with stripped/missing features, that's not cool codies. Not cool at all! Let me guess, it's coming with DLC? I don't want to even think that, but it does smell like it in all honesty. The driving itself is brilliant, but the game just doesn't have enough content.< Very sad camper!

content:
4, 2015
												UPDATEThe new patch that has been released today (August 20th, 2015) has fixed the multiplayer issue I had. In addition to fixing the multiplayer, it resolved a lot of in game issues that were listed in the update notes. Keep up the work Codemasters, this game is getting pretty good!Although the game has a low score, I wouldn't say it is that bad.PROS:Good driving physicsAI is actually aggressive enough to try overtakesGood graphicsRuns quite well on my rigPro season modeCONS:[Fixed in the latest patch] Multiplayer seems to be broken, or have no players (For me at least)[Fixed in the latest patch] Graphical glitches (The one I always get is the one where rear left tire keeps phasing in and out.)Penalty system that keeps penalizing me for contacts and collisions I didn't do.No safety car (Like, wtf? Why?)No career mode where YOU are the driver, instead you got to pick a driver from this season to play as.Overall, not a horrible game, just not quite finished in my opinion. Give this game a try once the price drops, or once some time passes so all the issues get worked out.

We should still have the option of manual/auto.Tire models seem almost too clean? Grass to rubber transition is instant instead of wearing off slowly etc.Multiplayer not finding any games for me /will be edited out when it does.Multiplay lobbies are friends only , right now it seems.Game is beautiful, but doesn't look like the next gen stuff from the trailers.If they are going to add Podium cutscenes, at least pull them off right, the funny music is extremely anti climactic, and no champagne spraying etc.Drivers hugging /Arm around the shoulders... LOL.FFB.I'm very sad, because i really wanted to give it a good review, but as of right now, it's not going to get one, Next gen game with stripped/missing features, that's not cool codies. Not cool at all! Let me guess, it's coming with DLC? I don't want to even think that, but it does smell like it in all honesty. The driving itself is brilliant, but the game just doesn't have enough content.< Very sad camper!

ry 7, 2016
												Wow, and not in a good way.  I made the mistake of playing a lot of MODERN racing games, like Asseto Corsa and Pcars, and somehow thought that the most recent F1 game would have the expected quality of a game made in this decade.  I was wrong.This is nothing more than yet another terrible console port with non-existant physics, poor graphics, very limited ability to interact (can't even look around using a mouse or anything, stuck with one view of right and left, no up or down, etc).  What garbage compared to the other current and far, far superior offerings on the market.What an absolute WASTE of the F1 rights to formula one games.  Its just wasted on a company that year after year puts out low effort, low quality garbage.  Good thing that there is enough on the market now that I don't have to put up with garbage.  I will NEVER buy another official F1 game so long as this company continues to hold the rights.  No more money from me, and thank goodness Steam allows refunds.  Don't waste your time, get a real racing game instead.

content:
0, 2015
												I'm a huge fan of the F1 series and enjoyed F1 2010, 2012 and 2013... but this... is ridiculous... and not even a beta version. It feels like an Arcade version and not a simulation with bugs over bugs.- Time Trails: -- Best Time not displayed, instead, only first time is shown as best-time. -- Ghost Car not best time but randomly choosen...- Multiplayer not working properly, -- other Players are behaving like bot's in race, not sync at all-- Qualify times are shuffled instead of driven (1.36.60 in Spa)-- Other Cars glitch some meters and get ghost cars-- stuck in spectator view and not possible to get back to the race overview without leaving the MP session- Collision system sloppy, Rules i.E. Cutting corners are often not recognized, Penalities not as in F1 Reglement...- No Coop, no Split Screen, no LAN option- Button remapping is not actually updating the keys in the menu- Menu and handling of a console game, to many unnecessary "Are you really sure" questions.- Bad Performance with Gamepad (Xbox 360 PC)- App_Crash on Game Exit- Graphic Glitches, tires not shown etc...After Sync issues with DiRT Showdown that were never fixed and MP issues in F1 2010 that could get solved through 3rd party tools like tunngle or hamachi, this is the worst CodeMasters release ...

number of helpful: 10 of 15 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
1, 2015
												The hype and buildup from Codemasters over the last 6 months or so, had this billed as a big step forward in F1 games, constantly talking about realism etc. This couldn't be further from the truth, and it says it all that I only have 10 minutes of play time clocked up. It's a console game that happens to run on a PC. Total arcade experience. Playing on a Logitech G27 wheel + pedals you very very quickly realise this is designed to be played with a controller, on a console, and is not trying to be in any way a race simulator. I will stick with Project Cars and Asseto Corsa - actual race simulators, or as close as we have today. Codemasters, how I wish you could go back and play TOCA Touring Cars 2, to remind yourself when you used to know what you were doing.Refund requested, for the first time ever on Steam :(

content:
20, 2016
												Weekend Free to Play Tester.I didin't spend really much time on this game , as i have tryed it only on the Free to Play Weekend at 18th Marth. I would not give this game a Bad rate like it's mostly got from other peoples for probably stupid reason because they play it on a potato , the game is definatelly not a trash , it's really makes much funn to race it because its easy to handle it , i don't had any problems with it , no bug's at all , the graphic is "Blury"  but precise and great and like we known from codemasters great optimized , doing a Long Race Event  without to have even one Lag @ Maxed out settings , brings a huge + to F1 2015I didn't had time to try the multiplayer ( there is a reason why i didint even try to get time for it ) , but doing some long custom race's , time atacks with lot's of laps and finished one Championship Season on Hard Difficult , and i have to say , that i have enjoyed every round. The AI is something that i was most positive suprised , they are not those that rams you of the road , but they do mistakes to , missing corners if taking to much Risk , Crashing , go of Track geting penalties , also you can see that they fight for a place like you do too , but still staying as an Clean Drivers.I used an Xbox 360 Gamepad to play it , and only in a fev minutes i already found my perfect setting to be available to play on my ideal line's ( of course without spending much time on car settup ) and was ready to go.The only problem had so far with this game is , that F1 2015 is a little to far away from a SIM Feeling , also to me , this is one of the most Arcade F1 Game i played so far. ( I played them all but not F1 2014 ) and second one was that every time i run the game before i race i have to select manualy my Gamepad Custom Setting that ive done , for some reason it will not select it by it self when i have setup everything "not a big deal , it takes 2 seconds".AIO  = I recommended this game if you catch it at some low Price , but for an aracade racing game i never would spend that Full Price.Again to notice: Weekend Free to Play TesterIf i Could , i would go for this deal that is available right now: - 60% = 19,99€ ( Aceptable )

content:
7, 2015
												Wow, thats all I can say. What a mix of emotions from this game. I'll start from the start, but before I do, Im not going to mention any sort of bugs or anything like that, just the game itself.Negatives: - I really enjoyed having my own career so not being able to play as myself only as a current racer really really sucks for me and is probably for me the most disappointing thing so far.- The second thing that really annoys me is the fact you cant edit the race distance which sucks. There's 3 settings of race distance and you cant edit that at all.- I enjoyed the Young Drivers Test in the 2013 game and thought it added a lot to it as a real career. In this game the first time you get to drive in career mode is the first practice session. To live the full experience of F1, there should be young drivers test and pre Season testing to learn to drive the car and even set up tips etc.I havent played a lot of the game yet but these are just some things I feel.Now positive:- I like the 2014-15 change over, not sure if it does, but I hope you can start the career in 2014 then at the end of the year it goes to 2015.- The new look start up menu looks good, and the start of each session with Crofty (As much as I dont like him or his voice) is pretty cool i suppose.- The new interactions with the drivers and engineers like the setup with the tablet, the pop up menu in the race, etc and the new setup options aswell.This is all I have so far but I will start playing a bit more and see how it goes.

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
7, 2015
												So I previously had a review for this game which was quite negative. Now some time has passed since the initial realese and some additional hours have been added to the playtime. So lets revamp this on how I feel about this game at this state;A lot of talk was about the game crashing which I previously didn't have any trouble with. However, I had stated that the game loaded very slowly which I can happily say no longer seems to be a case.I'd spoke a little about the graphics, I still don't truely belive there is any difference graphically compared to the other games. It has improved, there are lower flickers and edges, but there are still some common graphical issues that do occur! The game options have now been updated and finally do stick when you've selected them, so no more fiddle faddeling just to set up a game. The sound is still fundamentally broken! It's a trait through every game I guess...The AI overall is a lot more challanging, though they do really still make very rookie moves and they have a tendancy to get in front of you and just brake and pull you off the track, causing your race to be ruined :/ sigh...The controller is still very much broken, a lot of improvements but still it's not where it should be, not even with custom settings. Car is very difficult to steer on steering lock, I could actually go as far as saying keyboard is better for a full lock turn... now that is shocking.Muliplayer? There practically is none. The hoppers are rubbish and custom matches you'll be lucky to find two or maybe three lobby. Likely when you get into that lobby and start a race, you'll find yourself getting passed by cars because you get ghosted (some weird glitch under braking) or if not that getting thrown into a gravel trap from some freaky alien glitch spinning you several times on the spot then leaping you out into that gravel l o l .. Penalty system.. well, should I say more.. However the timings and connection does seem much more stable, not really a pro though when you consider the other glitches. Overall it would be an OK game to buy, for £10 or less (if you didn't own any other versions) Though I would probably recommend you to get 2013. Paying anything more though is just asking for dissapointment. I don't think I can recommend this game still at this time though because I just don't truely believe that it's a finished product. Updates come out rarely and when they do they're not resolving real time issues.Though that doesn't mean it can't change my mind in the future.Sort your ♥♥♥♥ out Codematers, and finish this damn game!

content:
7, 2015
												I will be conciseThe game. Is. Hm glitchy :3Ok now seriously The positives: - New handling model, on the first try i utterly hated it but now i got used to it and realised the game has the most realistic handling model i have ever tried (haven't played sim games tho to compare). - Improved sounds, it reminds me more of the cars i hear on real f1, unlike f1 2014 where ferrari had completely different engine sounds, and zero physic sounds. Now they all come to play.- I would say slightly improved graphics, tho i was awaiting for more, it's just seems an up-resed version with better reflections and lighting system. But i will also put the negatives about the graphics here, as i said there isn't much improvement on colours etc. It seems the same engine to me. The lighting on some places is utterly bad, i mean how are the legs of the drivers able to be so bright? they are under the car, they should be shadowed, and i wonder how i am the only one so far who talks about it. The shadows on some cars especially under the mirrors or above the wheel, are only pixels bigger than my fingers, and generally they could have done a much better job with graphics.- The commentary pre and after race, in addition to the grid showcase put some life realism into the game, but for some point after, the commentary isn't something special, it get's boring. Now the negatives: I actually have no idea from where to start about. I might say the same things as other guys said thought i only read a few reviews, because i bet most of the problems are problems that we all have- No career mode. No need to discuss that further.- No safety car. No need to discuss that too.- Single player glitches. For instance those only a few i found since day one: Pit stop glitch   Time Trial Glitch   Not to mention many others like top speed failures some times, being on mercs with drs and sleepstream and the mclaren gets away, or AI crashing like hell sometimes. Anyway- They removed the old system lobby, to be able to search for an exact custom race and find it. Now it's almost impossible for example if a big youtuber hosts a lobby, they is no way people can join, unless the hosts invite them. Unbeleavable.- Even with the removed old system lobby, we hoped we could do some racing on the standard types of races the game offers. No way this could have happened. Even u can't join a lobby, if you can, there might be a race winner since lights go out, if it doesn't people will dc or get dsq on pit stops, or people might be driving on the same lobby, different circuits and the same times. WTF IS THIS. Multiplayer=UNPLAYABLE-Enough. I already got tired i have no more energy to think of other negatives xD IN CONCLUSION:  I think the game has a lot  of potential with the new handling etc. Codies just fcked it up with the features and glitches. About the glitches, there is a high posibility they gonna fix them soon via patch. About the features, I HAVE NO CLUE what they were thinking when they said "oh let's remove career mode it will make the game better" or "let's change the lobbies style, now people are forced to wait to play on a random lobby instead of joining through a list of available hosts".The game is restrictive and bad at the momment, but at least I, as a massive F1 fan, i enjoy playing single player a little bit, challenging on time trial etc. So I should not recomment this game, and that's what i do, thought it has new handling model, slightly improved graphics in general, and the potential of being a good game after they sort of the glitches.P.S:  SHOCKING interview with Codemasters engineer about this game   :P

content:
3, 2015
												Rubbish. This is my first steam review as I normally don't bother writing them, but I couldn't let this slide .. the game is terrible. I've come across four bugs in under an hour. First, the keyboard doesn't work for navigating the menus so you can't change default controls (I googled and eventually found if you disconnect all of your controllers you can eventually get it to work), then the left rear wheel just constantly flickers. Then for some reason when I pressed the accelerator the wheels animated and eventually started smoking but the car didn't move at all on track (not a traction control problem, another bug). Then the cinematic cut scenes are garbled too. Another possible bug (not included in the four above) is getting errors when the game tries to communicate with the steam servers (something I've never experienced with any other game). I've played the previous games in the series and quite enjoyed them. If you want a decent racing game at the minute I suggest assetto corsa. Codemasters should be embarrassed. Getting a refund.

There is this little something sim racers like to do and thats GETTING A PROPER FOV based on screen size and viewing distance you FU@$ ♥♥♥♥♥. (MODers let me)So you got Anthony Davidson, who does a bit of the simulation stuff for Mercedes, as your handling consultant and In terms of detailed feedback, it's Anthony first and foremost. So I've never driven an F1 car, but if this was going to be a SIM like you said over and over should the wheel have high speed vibrations? (yes), snap over or understeer?(yes). I've played the f1 mod for ACorsa and they got them in there. Did you do ANYTHING the real drivers said.Their is NOWAY Lewis played this game and liked it (Codes stated he gave it a go on many occasions) I bet he was like "damn its just like driving the real thing, the steering and FFB is so close to real life, Ive always wanted a bathtub racing sim, so when do I play F1" (MODERS have got FFB to feel good). YEA, YEA everyone says FFB is a personal thing, BS there is GOOD force feedback (fools your brain into thinking your driving a car and BAD FFB you can tell your playing a game) This is the latter. There is NOWAY you can sitdown in cockpit view and tell me it feels like your behind the wheel of an F1 car. (Modders in Acorsa have captured that terror and thrill)Why is their NO telemetry in this game, not FFB cliping tool, no brake or gas tool? Ohh, because its a sim and you don't need those in a sim. LOLBack when i was a Child i enjoyed childish things, but as i grew older in sim racing I have learned to leave childish things behind. F1 2015 is to me childish, If you like the game more power to you, i wish i could, man do i wish i could. Go back to a time when i didn't know what sim racing was, what FFB meant, what FOV or telemtry was. Back to a time when i thought GT and Forza where sooo cool.Own a modded t500rsI5 oc 4 ghz770 oc8g ram

content:
6, 2015
												It seems that what they call a 'next-gen' F1 game is releasing an empty game with stripped out features and a glitchy mess.Pros:The graphics are a decent step up and runs mostly smooth on my PC.The handling model and traction feel a lot better than 2014.The new menus are a nice step up from the plain old ones.The sound is improved compared to 2014.Inclusion of the 2014 season.Cons:It is quite clear that some graphics though were given more polish than others. The cars look nice and the night tracks have great lighting but the character models still look last-gen.Not a major con but the commentary can sound pretty forced at times.The AI is a lot more challenging which is good but at times they don't seem to acknowledge your exsistence and are happy to cut you off, clip your tyre and block you on your qualifying lap.I can live with not being able to put my name in on career mode but it seems that all depth has been taken out and just feels like a glorified quick race mode.As someone who does simracing, the force-feedback was pretty lackluster on my G27 wheel.Various graphical and HUD glitches. (Anyone want to race against floating sets of tyres?)I didn't even bother with online but from what I've heard it's pretty broken.I was hoping for big things jumping into next-gen but this feels like an empty and lackluster experience. Probably rushed out to make a quick buck and as the only official F1 game, this is unacceptable. It's not horrible but is slightly above average at best. I wanted to like this game but I couldn't get much out of it. You're better off with F1 2013 which I still consider the best out of Codemaster's F1 lineup.

number of helpful: 8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
0, 2015
												No TrackIR supportNo SLI supportBarely looks better than last year (and I'm playing on the max settings)It's Formula One. If you've played the others, you know what to expect - fast cars go around a track. It hasn't really changed all that much, even with the new engine. For me, it runs decently (i7 4790k@4.5/16GB RAM/SLI 980). Hangs around 80fps, though did drop to 50 at one point. Many people have severe framerate issues though. For what it is, it's not that well optimised if it requires a 970.What really gets me is the lack of TrackIR support. TrackIR is a headtracking tool that allows you to look around by moving your head in real life. In these racing games, it's really quite useful. Dirt Rally has it. The older F1 titles have it. F1 2015? Nope. If you go into proper first person mode with the camera, you lose half of your mirrors. You can use a button to look left or look right, but this removes the front view. With TrackIR I could just move my head slightly, still be able to see out the front and see the entire mirror. Handling I found was pretty decent, really light on the Force Feedback though, can be changed in the settings at least.The AI is not all that great. I'm pretty sure they should avoid crashes whereever possible, but they instead like to just ram me out of the way. Even on the starting grid, I was messing about looking for the look left button and wasn't moving, but a car decided to just drive straight on into me instead. Maybe he should have gone to Specsavers.They've fixed some crashes, but I still had a crash in the menu.Sound is poorly mixed. The pit crew is barely audible. From what I can hear, it's some poor voice acting.Also, it might interest you to know that the console users can communicate with their pit crew via commands over the microphone. Codemasters decided to leave it out of the PC version.Conclusion: Buy the older titles, this is yet another rubbish port of the console version.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2016
												First off, I'm playing on Linux with an i7-4770k, GTX 770 4GB, 16 GB ram and a driving force GT (DFGT).Feral Interactive did the port, and based on others reviews it seems they made it work better than Windows. Sure there's slightly worse performance and a few bugs here and there, but generally it's working great. Best of all, Feral responds to bug reports and actively tries to help!Performance wise I get a steady 40-50 FPS with spikes up to 90-100. More consistent FPS would be nice, but it's an issue out of Ferals control. The game has never crashed for me either. Sound has wigged out once, but a simple restart of the game fixed it.AI seems to be a popular complaint as well. I fully agree that they need improving, especially when they get blue flagged. It doesn't ruin the game for me though. I'd be happier seeing more AI difficulty options or at least less drastic skill differences between difficulties. The jump from hard to expert or legend is just a bit too big, especially when comparing qualifying performance to race performance (AI performs better in the race).The final thing I'd like to see improved is Linux wheel support. If I wasn't as familiar with Linux, I'd have a hard to sorting out the wheel settings. For anyone running into problems my strategy has been to use ltwheelconf to set turn radius and such, then use jstest-gtk to calibrate the wheel and peddles. It has to be done once per time the wheels power is disconnected or your computer is restarted. I also set the steering saturation in game to around 40-60, otherwise the in game wheel isn't quite in sync.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
0, 2015
												Edit: Dropped recommendation for now (as of July 14th)---------------------------------------------------------So after a year of hiatus, I decided to give a shot on F1 2015. After a few minutes spent on the track, my first impressions are of mixed-bag...Good:-Massive improvement on engine (PU) sounds compared to F1 2014-Significantly better looking than F1 2013.-Handling is very good (with a joypad)-Podium Cutscenes (but I don't mind about the in-game narrator)-Well optimized. Runs at 60fps with a r9 270, i7 4770 on medium/highs after driver update-Almost instant flashbacks, and because of the AI's behaviour, it's a relief-Can change race settings during loadingBad:-No safety car-Damage physics are several steps backwards compared to previous installments-Can't disable texture blur-Penalty system seems more lenient on crashes-Split-screen taken away-The McLaren Honda engine sounds terrific...-Online features are broken. When I hosted one game, there were 10 players, but when I start the race, all players but one just disappeared and the game kicked me to the main menu due to "not enough players". Also when I join a lobby, I'm always kicked from the start. Bring back open lobbies, and fix this please !-AI is aggressive on Medium and Hard setting, they pushed me several times out of the track.When they get ahead thanks to DRS and/or a superior power unit, the AI just changes its trajectory and brakes hard, preventing the player to overtake back and get the nose stuck to their rear-end instead...Can't imagine Pro Mode without flashbacks then (or with a non-Mercedes powered car ).Mediocre-...but still sounding dull , especially on downshifts and in the pit lane-lack of personality. I personally appreciate the scrapping of the tutorial mode on single player and the email messaging system on career mode. Championship mode is enough for me, but I guess I'm in a part of the minority on that one-the game crashes on exit-Non realistic practices sessions-the steering wheel display could display more useful information -still no installation lap...-sometimes, the leaderboard is not getting updated in time trial mode (bug)-the HUD has not evolved much since F1 2010-Penalty system for corner cutting is annoying: it doesn't mind if you cut on Chicane at Spa and gained 1 full second, but it gives a 10-second penalty (25%race) when putting 2 tires out on 130 R and losing some time at Suzuka. Ridiculous.ConclusionThe series have been overhauled with a 'new' game engine, but it's hampered by teething issues and limitations so it needs some maturation before the major bugs get ironed out, and more features to come for the next year. 6.3/10.

content:
7, 2015
												Update 3 : 21/08/15 : Man, this game just keeps getting worse. I now get full AI opponents in a multiplayer lobby. THat's it. I'm never paying for a Codemasters F1 game ever again.Update 2 : 04/08/15 : This edit is regarding the 31/07 patch. After playing the game for 4 days after the patch, it seems like the Codies are making slow progress towards fixing the patches. A lot of annoying bugs have been ironed out and framerates during gameplay is also much better but they have yet to fix one major issue with this game and that is MULTIPLAYER. It is more broken now than ever. I just can't find one single lobby or hopper or whatever they're calling it now to play in. This needs a fix and my review will stay negative till then.Update 1 : 23/07/15 : Okay, it seems the 20/07 patch pushed in by the codies has fixed a few issues like framerate drops and crashes but it does not fix ALL the issues. There are still a few stutters here and there and needs a lot more fixing. The multiplayer is still broken and I'm still getting kicked from sessions for no bloody reason so my recommendation is still a NO.ORIGINAL REVIEW : This game...this could be so much more than it is right now. I don't know where to begin. This game is just BROKEN.The graphics are an obvious improvement from the previous titles and the handling seems a bit realistic than before but you buy racing games to have fun and I don't think I've had much fun with this game until now.The game is marred with bugs and the multiplayer is just broken. I joined a hopper sprint in excitement to play my first ever multiplayer online on this game and the race doesn't start for me. I know this because the other people in the lobby keep screaming at each other that they someone rammed into someone else and he had to lose his front wing, etc. So, I decide to quit and rejoin the hopper. I have no idea how but the hopper shows that I finished second and scored 18 points. As I rejoined the hopper, the other guys got furious at me and started abusing me and questioning me as to how I scored 18 points when I left the lobby and kicked me from the game. What a horrible experience that was. I still haven't come around to playing one single multiplayer game. What a shame!As to the Championship Mode, it's a meh. I have no idea why Codemasters decided to take away the customization options as to how one approaches a weekend race, be it one shot quali, short weekend or the full weekend experience. All that is gone now and you are left with no choice to play the game by their rules. Such a fail!The quick race mode is nothing new. Just play a boring single race and come back to the home screen. Not much improvement other than that.I haven't played the pro-season mode yet and I don't feel like I should be playing it either as you won't have any sort of assists and camera customization options and since I use a keyboard and not a racing wheel, it is almost impossible to control the oversteer on the cars in this game without traction control cranked to full. This is another one of those meh issues in the game.The graphics are great but the optimization for the PC is terrible. TERRIBLE! This could've been done so much more better. There are also just so many bugs in the game, it just takes away the enjoyment of racing an F1 car. The pit-lane graphics and sounds are just horrible and there are sudden framerate drops all over. There is nothing we can do but hope that the Codies fix this stuff in the coming patches.If you are really interested in F1 and want to immerse youself in an experience which is enjoyable as well as challenging, I suggest you buy the F1 2010 or 2013 game(s). These guys are just taking more stuff away with every iteration of the game.

												As of writing, release day, this game has serious issues on the PC platform. Consider this before buying.== GAMEPAD / INPUT ==01. If you are using a game pad (Xbox 360 or Xbox One), wait for a patch before you buy the game. Currently this game doesn't work as advertised with mentioned peripherals. Buttons "B" in menu system are actually "A" when pressed. In the game itself it's even worse: The defaults are messed up unlike in previous F1 titles by Codemasters. If you start a race, you're engine is revving, but you just can't do a bloody thing... Remapping the buttons doesn't help either - the Xbox gamepad just isn't supported as it's advertised.02. No sliders & adjustments for deadzone and input control. Every racing game should have this, especially those who advertise themselves with a "pro season" mode, aka, some sort of== GAME CONTENT ==03. There's no more scenarios. I kind of miss that, it gave some sort of extra to tinker with. A different challenge.04. There's no other challenges other than time trial, quick race and season modes. So no earning "medals" etc.. No leaderbords online? Ugh...I could go on, but essentially, codemasters needs to fix the game first. I'll go back to playing DiRT Rally for now - because there my Gamepad does work, there I can safely rebind keys and edit settings.. And oddly, it's the same company. Go figure...

content:
0, 2015
												MY GOD THIS GAME IS SCREWED!I have played a lot of racing games in the past and have previously played F1 2011, F1 2012 and F1 2014. I was really hyped for this game, but my god they screwed it up.+Better and cleaner UI+Better AI, the AI actually overtakes you this time+Beautiful lighting+Realistically modeled cars+You can push the car more due to less unpredictable wheelspin+Both the 2015 and the 2014 F1 seasons are playable+Better commentery/tv-style+Tire sqeal can finally be heard properly-Game crashes alot-FPS drops are common, dropping to 9 FPS and staying there very frequently-Colours are very washed out-I cannot look back in the 3rd person view-Engine sounds are far too quiet-Limited Anti-Aliasing options, WHERE IS MSAA?-Blur, motion blur cannot be deactivated, WTF?-No introduction scene before the race start like in previous games-AI likes to punt you in the wall in some corners, for example Eau Rouge-The graphics are messed up, everything is very blury and smeary, absolutely horrific, WTF HAPPENED?-No safety car, WTF ARE YOU THINKING CM?-No Co-op, WTF ARE YOU THINKING CM?-FFB is horribly weak and inacurrate, almost no effects, worse than every before in a CM F1 game, WTF HAPPENED?-Why is it not possible to adjust each session length in championship mode?-Damage model is pathetic and far too forgiving, wait is this 2005 or 2015?-Rev counter on the steering wheel is still broken and far too short like in F1 2014-ALT+TAB does not work properly-Hardly any tire smoke when locking up-Long loading timesPC specs: i7 4790k, r9 290, 16GB DDR3, G27 for more info see my profileAll in all I cannot recommend this game in its current state, the game is completely screwed, lacking featuires and will make you want to buy a pair of glasses. To be honest F1 2014 is probaly a better buy. I think I might test Steam's refund policy.10.07.2015, F1 2015 v.1.0-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------EDIT:So after raging quite a bit yesterday I completed a few 25% quick races on different tracks with some of the 2015 and 2014 spec F1. Championship mode is literally unplayable due to it bein at 9 FPS the entire time. So in this small list I will go into the actual racing aspect of F1 2015 and the changes compared to last years game.+Handling model has been vastly improved, more traction, less unpredictable wheelspin, the rear of the car is still quite a challenge which is good+The AI actually races you this time around, there is lots of wheel to wheel action, and the AI even completes switchback moves and dosen't back out of a move very often+Pits stops are now just as quick as in real life and the times vary per team and your crew can mess up+The AI is not as slow on the first lap, like in previous games+Fuel management is now realistic becuase upshifting early and lifting and coasting actually make a difference+The AI race each other with realistic consequences+Front wing gets damags more easily+The effects of dirty are are noticable+Wet racing is possible again, due to the AI not being overpowered anymore+AI make mistakes and it is great to see them having to deal with oversteer and slipping on the grass+The sparks that fly from the car directly infront of you are implemented very well+Penalty system usually fairly affects AI cars+Racing is just more fun with all cars batteling each other a lot of the time, going 3-wide into corners and stuff like that+AI causes crashes+More cinematics, grid walk podium etc.+You can ask the engineer for information-AI is not aware of you when it is rejoining the track and subsequently knocks you off-AI cars which need to be lapped do not get out of the way most of the time, therefore endangering your race-The rev counter on the in-game steering wheel is still wrong, just like last year-When exiting the pits with the pit assist option deactivated you are stuck in 2nd gear, therefore you lose a lot of time-The AI is always, and I repeat ALWAYS faster than you in a straight line, I have had Mclaren-Hondas pull away from me whilst I am driving a Force India and using DRS-2015 and 2014 car balance is not correct: 2015: Mclaren, Red Bull, Sauber too strong; Mercedes powered cars too weak (The cars are correctly balanced when you are driving them, but not when the AI is driving them, 2014: Mclaren is too powerful, haven't tested the rest (Again the AI cars are not balanced for example the Marussia is not runnung in the back like the Caterhams are)-There are alot of races where the weather is grey and dark and it is raining, but the track dosen't look wet and the dry tires work significatly better than the intermediates-The AI like to drive away from you in a train most of the time and you don't have a chance due to them blitzing down the straights-The damage model is pathetic and way too forgiving most of the time-The side pod glitch has kinda moved to the area between the sidepod and the front wheels, touch a car there and you just spin-The fuel mode menu is too slow, so that it takes too long to switch between modes whilst driving-The "talk to the engineer menu" dissapears way to quickly after opening it, therefore rendering it useless-No tire smoke when youn lock tyres, or cars spin, therefore there are no immersive "trying to avoid an incident which has occured ahead" moments-Blury graphics and motion blur really strain the eyes after ~30 mins-When it start raining and you have to change ti intermidiate tyres and you do so on your schedueled pit stop and haven't used the menu to select the intermidiate tyres, you will have slicks put on during the pit stop, this affects the AI most of the time too-DRS is often enabled in wet conditions-A lot of scenarios where you better of with slicks on a wet trackAll in all the actual racing have vastly improved over last years game, now if codies would just address the blury graphics, add MSAA then this review would be positive and this game would be worth a buy.

content:
, 2016
												A fun racing title with some serious issues.The good: - multiplayer racing with friends is great fun - much better physics than previous titles in the series - nice and playable with both controllers and with wheels - lots of patches from codemasters this time to fix bugs and to update the cars performance and visuals - includes both the 2014 and 2015 seasonsThe bad: - no career mode - no classic F1 mode - AI on the hardest difficulty (Legend) is too easy - even with all of the patches, still a bit buggyOn balance - I got a lot of fun out of this game - mostly in multiplayer. The next title in the series (F1 2016) should hopefully correct the missing career mode.I'd like to see in future titles: - a way to set up a race to start dry and have rain start during the race, or to start wet and have rain stop during the race. Ideally so I could set it to start raining on lap X of a race, or set it to stop raining on lap X. - custom grids (like F1 2006 on PS3 had) - the ability to set up any starting grid you want - the return of classic F1 cars

												Everyone has an open mic because that's the only option. Can't mute people. Get kicked randomly from online games (it's the servers doing it, not people). Lag is a massive issue, like people are teleporting all over the ♥♥♥♥ing place. Positions aren't always correct, like i was third at one point and it said i was eighth, and then it said i was first and i won the race, then hate to wait 20 minutes for a guy that was still on lap 1 going 2mph to finish the race. No cool career mode where you have your own character. Acceleration and braking online with a controller has no sensitivity, so you either tap it a little and it'll accelerate massively or not. Every time someone joins the lobby, an extra minute is added to the launch time. When you tab out, the resolution of the game ♥♥♥♥s up and the size goes all weird, resulting in you having to go back to settings and change it all to 1920x1080 etc. Not user friendly. Doesn't give you a description of what some game modes are. No tutorial. Characters look worse than Garry's mod characters. Got a headache from foreigners talking to their families while racing, and hearing them tapping their buttons away. This was all within 90 minutes of playing.

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
0, 2015
												Has crashed twice in about five minutes. Missing Career mode and a host of other well liked features from the previous games (no career and no safety car for instance). Codemasters had an opportunity here to put together the best of all previous titles. A new engine and a mid season release for the first time. Sadly that opportunity is wasted. Hopefully these missing modes will get patched in and the crashing and other graphical anomalies fixed. This game is also missing the speculated day 1 patch. Would not recommend this game in it's current state. After the snafu that was Batman Arkham Knight, one would imagine publishers and developers would be particular about releasing sub-standard titles or at least in a buggy state. Clearly this isn't the case. I skipped 2014 because I thought they would bring all the advances made there to this release. I was mistaken. In what I view as an attempt to simplify or streamline the process of getting into a car and racing. Much of the flexibility has been lost. Polish of a few features is appreicated, but not at the expense of removing other much appreciated game modes and configuration options. One has no need for the 2014 season when the game of the matching year is readily available. Given that F1 2014 offers more in terms of gameplayt than 2015, why would one want a severly stripped down version of 2014 in this year's title? It is anything but a step forward. Avoid for now, perhaps forever. Codemasters may need to try again in 2016, but I'll not give them the benefit of the doubt. Perhaps I'll try 2017 again.

												Looks have improved, if not amazing, but better. To my mind it feels enjoyable and challenging with all assists off.Now here's the rub, forgetting the lack of features, because as far as I am concerned, if this game played as it should, I'd have overlooked that being this is a rewritten engine etc.There are a few bugs and niggles but I have played many of the other games and for all their faults there was never a problem with the force feedback. This game has so little sensation of wheel weight or contact with road surface. and I have a wheel that works fine with previous games. So how many weeks will I have to wait before my wheel gives me the proper sensation of racing? I have posted so much on the forum, and yet nothing. All I ask is that it works with my steering wheel like it used to. Or like it does with project cars to be honest, as that does a better job.Till then I won't recommend it to anyone and Codemasters really let me down this time and I'm usually a patient gamer.*edit: I have a new wheel now, (T300) and the feeling is better with this wheel, but I am still not happy with this game overall. The feedback is passable, but should be better and have much more flexible option to adjust. Thing is, this is a console game first and a PC game second, which is a shame. Codemasters support for this game is almost non-existant as well, and the same errors creep into the game year on year.I hope that from the news I am hearing, Codemasters are going to focus on their key franchises from here on in, and if they want my help, they will get it. The potential has always been there, F1 one on early -access anyone? Maybe we will get that telemetry we have wanted for ages after all.
