content:
0, 2015
												Completely underwhelming in comparison to Project Cars. Following install the game failed to start, blank screen for a few minutes and then thrown back to the desktop.  After a couple more tries I restarted my computer and the game finally loaded.  I set everything to Ultra and then ran benchmark.  Noticed the left rear tyre flashing in out of existence when the camera was following my car from behind, minor glitch maybe.  Seeing that my 980Ti easily delivered around 120fps 1440p I decided to engage vsync to limit the game to 60fps as there is no point wasting all that electricity on all those extra frames.  Graphically the game looks a bit cartoonish to me and feels more like an arcade game than a simulation. Hitting walls and other cars doesn't seem to cause any harm or damage, which kind of suprised me as F1 2010 definately felt like a simulation and in my view remains the better game.  On completing a quick race I noticed some rather more serious screen glitches in the post race sequences, though again I expect this will be fixed in future updates or drivers.  Also the replays seem to be fixed at 30fps which is strange. After another quick flick through the menus and not finding anything new of interest I had a quick race around Monaco and found this offered little excitment.  On quitting the game I was presented with Steam error 41; which is a new one for me; something about servers being overloaded or something but to be honest by this point I was beyond caring.  It remains disappointing that Codemasters do not support my old Microsoft Sidewinder wheel and peddles; particuarly given that Project Cars does; so instead I have to use an Xbox joypad. For me this speaks volumes about the quality of the games, attention to detail and the values of this company.  Overall, if you are formula one nut and have a compatible steering wheel then maybe you'll enjoy this game but anyone who has played Project Cars will feel completely underwhelmed by quality of this game.

content:
0, 2015
												I like it. It's not perfect but once i'm in a session i really enjoy it.I play with traction control set to med all other assists off. Hopefully i can turn this off soon too!My system is:i7 2600k16gb ram (I use dim drive and load the game into ram)R9 380 4gbDriving force gt wheel and pedal setCons: Weather forecast for race weekend missing, i can't set my car up for the race in qualifying if i don't know what the weather forecast is. DRS open conformation would be nice too, maybe flashing like it used to.Benchmark test crashes the game.No career mode (would be nice to have for some people but i play full race weekends over and will probably only get 2 full seasons out of it before 2016 is released)Pros:Force feedback is good. Tied in with that is the tire model. It took me an hour to get to grips with the game but once i did, i combined what i felt through the wheel with what i thought the car was doing and what the tire and brake temps were to drive the car. Now my tires generally surpass the initial pit window estimate while only losing 1.5-2 secs at end of life. I'm very rarely hard on the gas or brake anymore. I like the penalty system over old versions of the game as it is now more lenient and just give warnings for minor contact rather than a tour of the pits. i enjoy the commentary as well.Formation lap, different cut videos, etc, would be nice but i don't feel like they would add significant value to the experience.If you like f1 and are thinking about it, buy it!

number of helpful: 9 of 16 people (56%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
er 2, 2015
												There is a lot of trash talk and dissapointment about this game. I think it deserves better reviews. Sure, the lack of the progressive season mode is a shame but when you get past that, the improvements far outweight that small negative (that said, I don't do multiplayer so have no opinion on pro's or cons).The physics of the car are out of this world. I had F1 2013 and it felt like the car was on rails. The F1 2015 cars feel like they are on the edge when you're lapping. You can FEEL the understeer and oversteer through the wheel and putting together a fast lap is very rewarding as the physics will punish you for over-doing things.Tyre degradation and fuel management are now in your hands. You can slow down a tad and save tyres and fuel to change your race strategy. There is no option to change strategy before the race starts but you aren't "forced" to pit like in F1 2013. If you choose to race flat out, you will have to make an extra stop compared to a more conservative approach..The only other oddity is the AI speed. On Hard, it's fairly easy to qualify and race in the top three. Moving up to Expert, I was struggling to get in the top ten. Hopefully they'll patch it to make the gap a bit less radical. The AI also has a propensity to punt you off the track from time to time. Generally they race very well and you can force them into mistakes but it's very irritating to be on the correct line and suddenly "BOOM" you're spinning off the track.I highly recommend giving it a try. If you are bent out of sdhape by the lack of the young driver program you are missing out on a great racing sim for something that was only a fraction of the game.

												This game is an ultimate money scam. When the game came out it was already bad enough on the PC but some of the recent patches have improved the experience on the PC. However with this latest patch the AI is even more ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ than ever. Racing as Bottas I was confidently leading the Australian Grand Prix until the second to last lap where my team mate who was already lapped tries to be some sort of hero and he goes on to overtake me. He crashes into the back of me and then we both go completely spinning. Luckily I was 30+ sec ahead so I was still able to get back on track to lead the race. Then on the last lap my car goes absolutely bonkers and decides to stop working on the last couple of corners for no apparent reason. After being sent spinning again another car completely smashes into me and I have to retire a couple of corners from victory. With this latest patch the AI is even more ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ in getting out of the way when they are lapped. Instead of  pulling to the side they go completely straight out into a wall and most likely end up damaging their front wing or the entire car. And there are other problems like sitting on your team mate' ghost car when you go to pit or not getting out of the pits as well.There are other massive issues like big FPS drops when the into is played in the rain. I could go on and on.Do not buy this.

When I contacted Codemasters I got a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t generic reply stating that I am able to custemise the controlls. When I play their fancy new PRO SEASON which I was really looking foward to which is meant to have no assists and hardest difficaulty. The PRO mode, even thought is says that the assists are off still displays the racing line along with all other assissts. 												Game is blurry...I tried recommended settings from other users in forums and even at 1920X1080 with all graphical settings set to Ultra, SAA off, post process and motion blur set to lowest it looks like I'm playing in 800X600. Tried every settings. The environnments are constantly flickering, especially trees which give headache and motion sickness. They said they have improved handling, but to me it's a step backward. Doesn't feel like a simulation any more. You can now recover from any drift before the car spin, and hitting grass at 250 km/h feels like your still driving on tarmac. What a disappointment. Game is very short on content too compared to previous games in the serie. Finally, it's not even possible to tweak X360 controller deadzone, sensitivity, etc. You can only remap keys and that's all! This game is a joke. How am I suppose to make great use of the turns apex with default controller sensitivity is beyond me...it's completely unplayable...the cars are way too twitchy!! What a bad pc port this game is.

												An abomination of a game. I won’t even begin to mention all the missing features, the overly aggressive AI that takes great pleasure in ramming you off the road. Nor will I mention the fact that AI cars are just as fast going down the straight with DRS as they are without, or the fact that the engineer is downright useless, and will only inform you of weather and what tires the others are on, if he feels like it. Which is quite rarely.No the worst part is trying to finish the Chinese Grand Prix, again, and again and again – and just for the hell of it, one more time. But I can’t because random crashes are random. The only positive about them are, you’re pretty much guaranteed to have them. Don’t make my mistake, don’t buy this. Please for your own, and the future of the franchise, stay clear like Maldonado on a slightly greasy track, or dry – Just don’t go near Crashtor.

												Game is broken - - WHAT TROLL COVERS THE RIGHT SIDE MIRROR WITH REV/GEAR HUD !!!!UPDATE: Controller is now making the car move. However its quite "choppy" and feels like I am using a D-Pad and not an analogue stick.. Will see how it goes.UPDATE 2: The reason the car was not moving was due to the rear wheels spinning at MAX when no buttons were pressed, unable to get traction so car will not move. Nice waste of tyres.This still happens intermittantely and i need to restart the game to fix it. UPDATE 3: Whoever desisgned the HUD for the rev counter and poisitioned it over the right side mirror, is a ♥♥♥♥. The display is nice, but stupidly placed if I can not see what it on the right handside, behind me... Many crashes have happened Below is a list of issues with this title:The Race:- Starting a race, all you get is engine rev's and the car does not leave the grid. Changing gear works, but car does not move.Considering I cant move the car, I cant play this game.- WHAT TROLL COVERS THE RIGHT SIDE MIRROR WITH REV/GEAR HUD !!!!Good thing you can still see that mirror in most views but its covered by 2 of them.- Looking left and right in cockpit view (using 360 controller) sucks. You can't look a little left/right. Its either all the way or straight forward :-(Graphics:- Low frame-rate even on lowest settings- Subtitles are not in sync- Lots of screen tear- How do you turn the blur off?- Where are the advanced graphics settings?- Ability to use 2014's HUD for rev counter, gears, etc (as this obstrucs right side mirror in some views0Other:- Quitting the game causes the game to "Crash to desktop"- Lack of advanced controller settings (Dead-Zone)- FIX:For those who run the game and nothing happens: 1. Right click game in Steam2. Click on "Properties" > "local Files" > "Verify integrity of game cache"3. Restart PC and it should work. It did for meIf this game worked, I can see it being fun, but since I cant race, I cant tell.

content:
5, 2015
												In my opinion F 1 2015 is a gem of a game to start.You have to believe that with this (core) next gen style format is bound to get better period.It's been over three weeks since the games release with multiple patches added and each time various issues have been fixed.So what I'm saying is, lets all of us do our part to assist CM in delivering the best F 1 racerever by continuing feedback and being a little more  patient than we have been in the past .First on the assist/feedback list is ensure that you have the latest drivers for everything that's connected to your PC,( Vid ,sound,MS update,steam client,verify integrity software,wheel /game pad drivers,etc ). And then after all you have done is checked off, then do the olde basic complete shutdown and restart.  Not to discourage anyone but remember that this game was designed for the state of the art peripheral components, so an upgrade may be possible. Don't get me wrong but I also experienced all the issues that everyone mentioned in previous posts, and I do not not have the strongest rig, but those steps (mentioned above) really helped me to play and enjoy  the Formula 1 series which I love so much.I hope this helps more virtual drivers out there to be able to get on the tracks and enjoy this beautiful Formula 1 game for our PC version and kick some next gen arses. C U  @ the Circuit De Barcelona- Catalunya.Rig=Am3+ x4 985, R9 270, 970 game board, 16gb ddr3 and Win7 ultimate 64

												i do not understand why everyone hates this game so much. For sure there are some bugs and the online part is very laggy but apart from that it is really good. The AI is the best i have ever seen in a racing game they divebomb you but they are still fair. The Handlingmodell is really good aswell in my opinion it is on par with the iRacing one in generall of course iRacing is a little bit more unforgiving but in terms of the actuall limit of the car f1 2015 is more realistic because I was faster in the iRacing Mclaren than i was in the f1 2015 one. I think if Codemasters improve the right things f1 2016 even gets close to the almighty rFactor2 which is probably the closest a game can get to real life prooven by the Formula 1 Teams who use the pro version of Rfactor2 for their simulators. In my opinion f1 2015 already beats iRacing and the very iRacing-ish Assetto Corsa although iRacing is used by a lot of professional drivers due to their huge community. F1 2015 is better because of some little things such as the unstability under breaking or the handling in the corners. As a guy who has driven a Formula Renault 2.0 car once i have to say the f1 2015 one is more challenging than the iRacing one. But again i have to say nothing gets even close to Rfactor2. My Ranking of the sims I have ever played ( in terms of realism and singleplayer)1. Rfactor2- very realistic Handling, good and challenging AI, great price2. F1 2015- quite realistic handling, very good and very challenging AI(the best out there),very good graphics( 2nd best to project cars)3. Assetto Corsa- good handling but a bit to slippery and simple sometimes, at least some AI4. iRacing-good but too slippery and simple handling, no AI but good community5. Project Cars- too simple and grippy Handling, bad AI, bad community but good graphics- the letdown of the last 5 years

In my opinion f1 2015 already beats iRacing and the very iRacing-ish Assetto Corsa although iRacing is used by a lot of professional drivers due to their huge community. F1 2015 is better because of some little things such as the unstability under breaking or the handling in the corners. As a guy who has driven a Formula Renault 2.0 car once i have to say the f1 2015 one is more challenging than the iRacing one. But again i have to say nothing gets even close to Rfactor2. My Ranking of the sims I have ever played ( in terms of realism and singleplayer)1. Rfactor2- very realistic Handling, good and challenging AI, great price2. F1 2015- quite realistic handling, very good and very challenging AI(the best out there),very good graphics( 2nd best to project cars)3. Assetto Corsa- good handling but a bit to slippery and simple sometimes, at least some AI4. iRacing-good but too slippery and simple handling, no AI but good community5. Project Cars- too simple and grippy Handling, bad AI, bad community but good graphics- the letdown of the last 5 years

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
er 9, 2015
												*sees review again after several months* Why did I thumb this down? The game is not as bad as I thought it was back then, it's somewhere between a fully recommended thumbs up and a thumbs down. Read on if you want what I though of it back thenBroken with the same issues as its predecessors. Codemasters are incapable of making a good racing game these days. I got this free with a purchase of a laptop and even then I'm disappointed with it.The graphics look good on my gaming PC, better than F1 2013 (the last one I bought) and there are no issues there other than it can look cartoony due to the colour saturation. The driving is very smooth and for the most part the game plays at well over 60 fps on max settings, but there are cases where the performance just goes through the floor. And I don't mean consistently either, you can lap a track several times with no issues and then for whatever reason, on the following lap, the framerate will halve and stay there, feeling like a slideshow after playing at 80 fps or higher. The cars are very easy to drive and there's no real difificulty from the AI that I have seen. I have most of the assists off and use a gamepad, but the game doesn't seem to ever save my assist settings so I don't know if it reset my assists back to all enabled. I raced against medium AI around a couple of tracks and won the majority of races. Bear in mind I was in the Mercedes so a slower car would have faced more difficulty.The game is very light on features. There's no career, no online co op, no split screen (co op or otherwise) and I'm sure there's more missing. The session browser list for online is gone, instead there are hopper lobbies which take ages to fill up or are always empty. Once you're in an online game, it takes ages to load everyone in and once you're racing the poor penalty system will ruin your fun. Just had a race where I covered someone off on the inside line, they corner cut to overtake, hit me and take us both into the gravel and I got the penalty. Had another after that where I go to turn, accidentally tag somebody so I turn out to prevent causing an accident, still get the penalty (other player did spin though). If it weren't for the poor penalty system that seems too happy to dish out penalties I'd be more likely to recommend this game. This game also features non-existant force feedback. I can run over curbs and things and get no feedback from the controller. By comparison, Project Cars, you feel everything. I don't know what's good about this game really. Barebones features, poor penalty system, struggle to find games, takes ages to load everyone in, awful sound design, and not all that fun. 5 out of 10 at best

												**Revwiew for PC** with GTX 760 (i7) - mostly medium to low settings @ minimum 58 fps.If your a fan of F1 but were a bit fed up with the prior Codemasters F1 efforts then you have to get this game.Great graphics, much improved AI, excellent replays with variable camera angles, adjustable cockpit camera angle, and wonderfully immersive physics ! The key to this game is understanding , as far as I have found out, is that the game is intended to be driven with 360* of wheel rotation unlike the prior gen console versions that I have played. This will give you 1:1 steering ratio when set up in your Logitech, or other branded, wheel profiler. Setting up my DFGT did take a bit more effort than ususal but feels great now. Big step up codemasters ! Well done !

												Don't see what all the complaining is about to be honest! For starters this game is a massive improvement upon F1 2014, both in the graphics side of the game, and in the actual racing/handling. Some may be annoyed with the lack of a proper "career" mode, but even in the previous iterations of the F1 games from Codies you were still technically driving as one of the actual drivers (their name on the car and race suit etc.), so overall this doesn't bother me. Online, while a little laggy, is good fun to play, and as I said above, the graphics have literally been overhauled and look absolutely stunning, even on a mid-budget system! er 29, 2015
												Oh boy. This game truly is a legendary rollecoaster of emotions. First off I would like to say that I really, really wanted to play F1 season with proper licensed cars and bought it regardless of the massive amounts of negative feedback, but I should've listened. Damn it, WHY DIDN'T I LISTEN!?It actually played fine for the first couple of hours and I was really getting into it. I liked the handling model and overall look of the game, it looks like a proper racing game. But then I hit China in career and things started to go south real fast. This is the first game that I've actually seen to cause a BLUESCREEN when it burns down to ashes (Windows 8.1 64-bit). And it happens way too frequently! At the moment I am stuck in Bahrain, struggling to finish a 15 lap race which is unacceptable. I don't know if it's my imagination, but it seems car setup goes wrong when you load a game mid-weekend. I can set up a car, qualify it easily to top 10 (expert dif), get bluescreened, reload, go to race and Manors will fly by me during first lap. WTF? And how the F option tires give you greater straight line speed? I dunno, ask Codemasters, they obviously think it's part of the real Formula 1.PROS+Looks decent+Handles well sometimes+Steering wheel actually worked without a hassle (G27)CONS-CRASHES WAY TOO OFTEN-Aggressive and blatantly reckless AI squeezing through a postcard wide cracks-Stupid tire differences-Actually why do I even continue this list, SEE CON #1, it's more than enough of a reason NOT TO BUY this game!Codemasters, I know rushing a game to release in a certain schedule is a thing nowadays but please at LEAST have the decency to FIX YOUR GOD DAMN GAMES post-release. How hard can it be?

content:
ber 6, 2015
												Ok, first things first.. Since this is my first review and thus have no experience in writing one, I'm still gonna try. I mainly want to review this game because of the havoc it caused on the day of release, and I mean havoc in a bad way...I waited a couple days and finally, after some patches, decided I want to go see and play for myself. And let me get this clear right away, it's a blast!! Compared to the lame AI the previous F1 games from CM suffered with, this one is finally spot on!! I play the game on the hard setting with a xbox 360 controller and all the races I've played so far (I think just 5 of them on 50% race distance) are so much fun! I mean head to head action, racing as Vettel in the Ferrari against Hamilton till the very last round, it never felt so close as I could imagine what would be in real life. Only for that fact alone I enjoyed this game more than all it's predecessors. Off course every now and then you'd come around a (minor) glitch, but the question is if it's ruining the game and the answer too that is most certainly not!! At least not for me. I don't play online, so I can't give you my opinion on that, but if you're here to purely race as one of your favourite drivers and don't mind that there is no formation lap or safety car or other things they could (and should) have implemented in the game, then this is your go! Couple of possitive and negative points about the game (and I always think you should not take in consideration the ones that don't apply to you or what kind of game you're looking for)+ Handling (very well done, has been far worse in the past releases)+ Graphics (simply stunning 1080p ultra settings 60fps on my system)+ Racing experience (fight head to head with your components for multiple laps for the first time in an F1 game from CM)+ 2014 season (included for free)+ Speak with engineer (Very nifty and useful feature)- No career mode (I play championship season and don't mind, but if you want too progress year after year, it's not possible)- No safety car (Bit of a bummer Codies! It's like a soccer game with no refferee :|)- No formation lap (I don't mind, just wanna race, that is where I bought this game for)- Still some bugs (but CM is working very hard too patch them in the near future, am I right? ;) Not a game ruiner for me though)All in all, I defenitly would recommend this game if you're a fan of racing games (F1 in particular off course) and if you've played one of CM earlier F1 games, cause the overall racing experience in combination with the graphics really lift this game to the next level. Hope you'd enjoyed reading this review and made your choice wether too buy this game or not is now a little bit easier ;-)

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
0, 2015
												Update: There has now been a couple of patches and in fairness this review should be updated. The crashfest which was the released F1 2015 has been fixed and now seems stable. After testing the latest patch (22/7) I did not get any appcrashes or the notorious error 41. The AI has improved (IMHO) and doesn't rear end your car with monotonous frequency. It still happens but mostly as a result of excessively hard braking into a corner. The game still has issues with fault though, expect to be blamed for every collision whether or not you were on line and in front into a corner. Some of the menu operations are awkward such as the car setup "pad". Having to type in a save filename everytime gets tedious especially when you just want to update and overwrite an existing setup. I find now the racing pretty enjoyable. I don't have any particular problem with blur (@2560x1440) that some have mentioned and get a solid 60fps on a GTX980ti at absolutely maximum settings. I found the graphics initially appeared washed out with poor contrast which I tweaked up with sweetfx and now looks good to my eye (this may not necessarily be the game but an Nvidia driver issue). There is no sli support as yet. Control options are still very poor. I still can't get my wheel working but have sorted out a decent 360 controller setup after manually editing the file. Value of this F1 2015 over F1 2013 (I've skipped 2014) is debatable. Graphically it is moderately better but other than that losses out in features (and my wheel works in 2013). After the crash fixes I'd recommend it with a few caveats. Original review: This isn't a review of the game but the state of the game. Very, very, broken. You will crash alot but not into other cars, mainly the desktop. Get used to closing the Appcrash error box because you are going to get RSI doing it. In thirty minutes of play, it has crashed every few minutes at many different points; menus, benchmark, in game and even crashes exiting and causes the Steam client to crash with it.Graphically it looks good and runs smoothly but that's where the fun ends. Controller support is broken. Wouldn't recognise my wheel other than as an Xbox controller so it locks me out of wheel setup. Xbox controller support allows remapping of buttons only. No sensitivity, dead zone, gamma etc. Anyway using the controller is like digital steering, you may as well steer with the cursor keys.If the game gets patched up into a reasonable state it maybe OK but as it stands it's just another case of a PC game getting released without any quality control at all.

content:
3, 2015
												The driving and racing side of F1 2015 is very good.  There is a sence of control that is a level above the previous releases and that is the main thing about a racing game.There are two negatives.  I suspect both are fairly straight forward to address.  The 1st is the online experience in the hoppers is very poor.  The lobby does not tell you what is going on very well.  The countdown to start seems to reset itself.  The vote to skip track countdown replaces the countdown to start, which seems to reset itself again.  The 2nd is GUI elements to navigate the game.  I'm a PC user with a G27 wheel.  On some screens, console buttons (X, B, Y, etc) appear.These are both quality issues rather than gameplay.  The online hopper issue seems to really affect gamers decision whether to stay or leave in my opinion and it feels quite broken from a accessibilty POV.  The GUI navigation issues are presentation issues which do not affect actually navigating through the game.  The standard keyboard controls still work.The single player mode is solid.  The annoying forced learning to control the car from the previous is gone.  I'm personally happy that the career mode is gone.  It wasn't really challenging and was a grind for achievements.  I'm enjoying the handling elements a lot.  The game engine is solid...just remembered 1x game play quirk.  Yellow flag incidents.  ie:  accident happens, you'll hear immediately from your race engineer that the incident is cleared, event before the car has finished spinning.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
13, 2015
												First and foremost - most of the negativity is people having issues with their various wheels and controllers not working, that is not an active reflection of the game and they should go to Codemasters' blog for a fix, instead of giving the game bad rep. Secondly, there are lots of bugs, yes but the majority of the game-breaking ones are fixed and the game is actually a pleasure to play. I do however hope to see the ones that are in the game still ironed out and I do NOT forgive Codemasters for releasing a broken game. Third, I would like to comment on the gameplay, it is vastly improved on the 2014 game and it feels like a true racing experience and I enjoy the game a lot whether it is online or offline, with or without bugs, as most of the bugs when I'm playing are just hilarious anyway.Fourth, I'm with the whole community when they say they want their REd Flags and their Safety Car back in the game as they made the experience that more real when playing and they are essential in the game, especially where the AI are dumb in Monaco. I'd love to see a parade lap that's toggleable and I'd really enjoy a bump in the difficulty of the game when you're in the better cars on the grid, as it seems a little easy to convert poles into wins on high overtake capacity tracks when you're in cars such as Ferrari and Mercedes. Overall, yes I recommend this game, however make sure that you have a compatable controller or wheel prior to buying it, I use a wireless Xbox 360 controller and some cheap reciever and they're okay. It's fun and if you don't mind waiting for some features or for bugs to be fixed then definitely pick this game up.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
2, 2015
												I've only just bought this game and I'm loving it. Driving as Jenson Button, I have just completed the Australian GP on full race distance...no frame rate dips whatsoever, a smooth 60fps for 58laps. Handling is so improved and thus helps with consistency. Tyre wear is also more accurate with timely information from your engineer as to the state of your tyres...I got 14 laps out of the 'option' tyres and easily got 18 laps out of the 'prime' tyres before I had to pit. A.I. is more competitive and they make mistakes too...24 race incidents after the Australian GP!The engineer is vastly improved, not only does he give consistent, accurate information on tyre wear, he also informs you of fuel use, weather, lap times and time gaps between your nearest rivals.Graphically, it's an improvement over F1 2014 but it's no real showcase for next generation graphics. Crowd and officials are still oddly static and cardboard like, but that's only seen in the replays. Tracks are nicely detailed and accurate, although I noticed some 'blocky' trees and foliage, and I'm running the game on Ultra High settings.Commentary is limited to before and after the race...it's serviceable, it gets the job done! Replays are better as you can now cycle through all the cars in the race and watch them racing...something Psygnosis could do back in the 90's with their F1 game on PS1...but it's a nice addition. Only wish they would add a UI over the replays that gave you the lap, driver, laptimes etc.I could mention everything that's missing, but I won't because a 100,000 other people have probably already done that across the internet. I love the game so far and it is easily the best F1 game Codemasters have created yet!*Edit...maybe I've been fortunate, but I have encountered no bugs or glitches so far and I have now completed Round 2 The Malaysian GP! My system is high-spec but that wouldn't matter if there were bugs and glitches...I'm sorry for all purchasers who are having issues with the game and I sincerely hope you get them resolved soon!

number of helpful: 10 of 20 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
2, 2015
												I like this game! I realise I'm in the minority here, but if you give me a moment I'll clarify my point of view.First of all, this game is not perfect. It has bugs. It has missing features (you don't have a player career mode, you can't drive as yourself, there are practise sessions still missing). But what it lacks in features it makes up for in the racing. The races are good! Okay, if you drive as Lewis Hamilton, you're quickly going to take the lead and drive away from the pack. But f you choose, say, Button's McLaren or a Sauber, you're going to have a race on your hands to reach your teams goal (which is usually to finish in the top 10).The AI are pretty decent, they will give you a tough fight, they no longer back out of overtaking in the braking zones, and they'll go for small gaps. I've noticed a bug where you're sometimes called into the pits on the same lap as your team mate and have to stack up behind, but it doesn't happen all the time. And you can get around it by pitting a lap later.Weather modelling is about the same as always, so no problems there.The damage could do with being a bit more sensitive. I crashed into a driver who braked suddenly in front of me, and I suffered no damage even with full damage enabled. Front wings need to be more fragile.Aside from these problems, which are easy enough to work around, it's a good game. Is it the best F1 game ever? No, not by a long shot. But it's OK.Don't expect too much. Go into it expecing a no frill, no nonsense F1 racing game. It's not a full on sim, but it's not an arcade game either.

												The issue:My framerate is a solid 60-ish per second. About 2 times per lap, it drops to somewhere around 12 to 15 fps, stays there for 10 seconds, and goes back up again. This happens both in the benchmark as in the championship mode, with cars from both the 2015 and 2014 season.System Specs: Windows 7 SP1 64-bitCPU: AMD Vishera FX-8350, Eight-Core,Motherboard: ASUS M5A78L-M/USB3RAM:  Crucial Ballistix Sport 12GB DDR3-1600,Video card: Nvidia GTX 750 Ti 2GB, Hard Drive: 1000 GB Sata III Driving equipment: Using the pedals of the Thrustmaster F430, with the wheel of the Logitech Driving Force GTDX Diag: {LINK REMOVED}http://www.mediafire.com/download/zb49cwq0cexnqr5/DxDiag.txt ;Steps to reproduceSimply enter a race (Tested with Australian Grand Prix) or run the benchmark. What have I  done to try to fix the problem?Given that I earlier reported some issues on DiRT Rally too, I wanted to check my system first.Since that other bug report of mine, I've reinstalled Windows, made sure no other major processes were running in the background (Other than Steam)I've opened up my PC case and cleaned it of any dust (There wasn't much, which wasn't a suprise considering it's not even a year old and well-maintained)I've kept an eye on the PC temperatures while playing several games, it never reaches oddly high temperatures (Never above 60 degrees celcius in GTA V on pretty high settings, for example)I have turned down the graphics settings and ran without V-sync to test it.I've checked whether there was a driver update avaliable for my PC. There wasn't.How long was your current session?I've had several sessions. Some were short, with me going in the menu and starting the benchmark straight away. Also I've tried running a 100% race weekend, which I ran till about 50% of the race and saved there because the issues were really annoying me.

content:
, 2015
												This is a truly amazing F1 game but lacks a lot of game modes. The car physics feel fantastic and the force feedback is great. You can really feel the bumps and speed thanks to the improved soundtrack and new engine which makes it feel and look like a totally different game to F1 2014. Graphics have been greatly improved and I can run it at a smooth 60fps maxed out at 1440p with gtx 780 SLI (Not sure if SLI profile is out yet). The AI feel more challenging on higher difficulties and use the track to how I watch F1 on TV. The new weather conditions look amazing and really change the way you have to drive compared to last years game and most of the tracks look great as well. Stormy weather conditions look photorealistic especially on the Singapor track. I want to mention that there are no safety cars in the game and I have no idea why. Also the hit collision is so bad you can get away with pretty much anything (hopefully a mod will come out to fix that just like F1 2014)Pros: Greatly Improved physics          Greatly improved graphics (adds immersion especially with the soundtrack ingame)         Realistic AI          performance is good (While I cannot play in 4K as I get around 40fps I am waiting for an SLI profile to fix that and there is a benchmark you can loop to see performance like F1 2014)         Can choose to race in 2014 cars and season and 2015 cars and season         Amazing weather conditions (graphically and gameplay wise)cons: No career mode          Cannot foward time in practice or qualifiying quick enough           Can be demanding if you have a lower spec machine (Lots of graphics options to tweak though)          Graphics are great comparing to F1 2014 but not the best compared to the newest racing games like project carsMinimal style TV intro with commentary which could have been much more as it lasts for like 10 seconds.No safety cars Bad hit collision and damage If you love F1 games or have an interest in F1 I would recommend this game only if you have a good spec machine, dont mind some of the missing game modes and enjoy racing games.

content:
r 16, 2015
												So, I think that I should leave positive feedback. Yep, because it's not so bad as described.Yes, this is was a mistake to release F1 2015 in early year. Otherwise, it would be possible to eliminate interface (control) errors. Then the game would received more positive reviews.It lacks a career mode that allows you to transition out of 14th year season to 15th. And I'm not talking about a career in which for example for Williams can fight some "W0menLorD2003". No, because a real pilot has certain sponsors. Needless to talk about PDVSA, etc. With the current system of licensed pilots, it looks more realistic, and I like it.Fiddled with software of my device, I was able to achieve good handling. I want to note that driving in 2015th game is more Interesting and complicated than in F1 2014. This is a big step forward.Of course, the graphics has become better. I like colors in F1 2015, but, of course, blur spoil all the experience. And modes do not fix it to the full. Here's another example of the console port. :\ However, I liked the game menu and its "soundtrack". Many are dissatisfied with the lack of alcohol logos. Yes, like others, I want to see Martini logos on FW36 and 37 and in the team name. But have you ever thought about game's age rating? As I recall, the rating increase is costly. And this applies to all genre of games.Another blunder is a SC, of course. I don't know why it was deleted. Sad, but true.Unfortunately, I did not see the manifestation of the great thinking of AI cars. AI became more agressive and only. But it can talk about my lack of experience.At the same time the game has become more lively due to the staff, commentators, etc. Not as much as it could, but it looks more advantageous against the background of the 13th and 14th F1.This is not the last game in the series, and devs have something to strive for. Taking into account its current mistakes, they are able to make a truly worthy project. Just take your job seriously, guys.

												I feel the game is now at a point where it is actually worth looking at. The launch was terrible and I am glad the reviews were bad and Codemasters lost money. There is no excuse for that garbage they put out earlier this year. But after ~10 patches the game is finally good.The good:- Graphics are beautiful and performance is fine- The AI is fantastic- The handling is better and doesn't feel like you are driving on rails- Actual performance differences between the cars - you won't be able to win with a Honda- More management from the driver is needed during the race (tyres, fuel, engine, brakes,...)- Dynamic weather- Great presentation and feel- Includes 2014 and 2015 season (which means we get Hockenheim)- FOV settingsThe bad:- Multiplayer is a cluster♥♥♥♥ and not enjoyable- Some things feel scripted and not simulatedVerdict:It is in my opinion the best F1 game we've had in years. It took a while to get here but it is an absolute cracker. The new AI and better handling make it feel like it is a totally new game (which is most likely is). Love it.

												As a gamepad user, this has the best controls on a Codies F1 game yet - FAR ahead of both 2013 and 2014Outside of the controls, the AI is better (it doesn't give-up places even on lower difficulties) and the track bounds are tougher on corner-cutters which is long overdue.  The cars also seem to model aero better, you can feel the car digging-into fast turns and being committed matters more than it did in earlier gamesTrail braking (braking into a corner) is punished more now - you need to be tidier, you can't save your mistakes so easily!!Graphics are certainly more detailed but they're also pretty demanding - i5 4440/650 Ti Boost sees 45-60fps on med/high settings which isn't brilliant but isn't as bad as it sounds/is perfectly playable (and lowering settings doesn't really improve fps numbers anyway)An outstanding bug seems to be your own engine being too quiet (other cars actually drown it out in all but cockpit view) but that's teaching me to look at the revcounter instead of trusting my ears (these hybrids aren't really designed to be revved-out to the limiter anyway)I did have a couple of crashes (to desktop that is!!) but a "Verify Game Files" sorted those out.I don't really play online so I can't comment on that I'm happy tho - as a pad player, it's the best F1 'drive' yet.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
ber 16, 2015
												Pwah, PUT YER READING GLASSES ON! I'm delivering an indepth review. Ok where do I start. I've followed Codies ever since Colin McRae Rally 2.0 (as stated in my previous reviews for Codies games) as an avid racer I couldn't wait to see what they could do with their first Next Gen release for Formula One. Well for a start I can see a repeat of their first series into the F1 Franchise with F1 2010. No safety car, non-dynamic weather, average AI. But that slowly built up as the sequals were released so I am hoping next years game will be more feature full. Focusing on this game. F1 2015 brings the 2015 season and the 2014 season into one package for the next gen consoles. GRAPHICS: The engine has been rebuilt (so they say) and everything has been reworked. The game looks and feels great, running at 60fps at 1080p on both my laptop, and my PS4 and looks absolutely stunning. The game looks its best in the wet weather where the detail is immense!HANDLING: The handling of the game has been reworked so the car feels more realistic but I feel the car is almost way to easy to stop under braking. It feels like ABS is always on, even though I don't use the Driving Aids. Wet weather conditions will make any racer nervous to stray off the racing line to attack, as you will most likely end up in the gravel.DAMAGE: This is one big letdown. The damage model of the car is virtually unchanged, while it may be easier to clip your front wing, its taken a backwards step compared to other games like Project Cars, rFactor 2, Asseto Corsa. Even their own DIRT Rally has a better damage model and it was released before F1 2015. There seem to be NO MECHANICAL FAILURES, like brakes, ERS failure, flat spots and the only time i get a puncture is if I deliberatly punt the car into the wall hard enough.AI: The AI have been reworked as well, I play on legendary settings and they seem to manage their tyres better while still keeping up with me, often performing better. I tried some tyre savings but dropped off the pace, may have to change my tactics. AI like to make mistakes, sometimes clashing with each other and losing a front wing but nothing special compared to f1 2013. Another thing is if an AI hit you (yes HIT YOU) they tend to push your car into the wall, or spin you, while they continue as if there was no contact.REPLAYS/FLASHBACKS: Replays now allow you to see the action from not just your car, but any car you wish so you can see just how awesome that crash was. However the replays are slighty broken as once you perform a flashback you cant go back and rewind further. This made me lose a race as while overtaking a backmarker on the last lap I got hit and spun into a wall, as I used a flashback I hit the button too late and it flashbacked to after the spin and was unable to use the feature again to get out of it.SETUPS: Setups are ok, a few nicks from me, I cannot change a setup during a quick race with no practice and no qualifying. Or if it rains while the qualifying was dry on low downforce packs the AI seem to have a leading edge in the rain, almost like their setup changed. Funny that.In closing the game is the start of new things to come, it has bugs, its not feature full but its a good start of the Next Gen series. Compared to Dirt Rally (the sister game released prior) it feels like the F1 games don't get the development they need to be a great game for racers and feels unfinished. I still recommend this game however.

content:
ber 16, 2015
												Pwah, PUT YER READING GLASSES ON! I'm delivering an indepth review. Ok where do I start. I've followed Codies ever since Colin McRae Rally 2.0 (as stated in my previous reviews for Codies games) as an avid racer I couldn't wait to see what they could do with their first Next Gen release for Formula One. Well for a start I can see a repeat of their first series into the F1 Franchise with F1 2010. No safety car, non-dynamic weather, average AI. But that slowly built up as the sequals were released so I am hoping next years game will be more feature full. Focusing on this game. F1 2015 brings the 2015 season and the 2014 season into one package for the next gen consoles. GRAPHICS: The engine has been rebuilt (so they say) and everything has been reworked. The game looks and feels great, running at 60fps at 1080p on both my laptop, and my PS4 and looks absolutely stunning. The game looks its best in the wet weather where the detail is immense!HANDLING: The handling of the game has been reworked so the car feels more realistic but I feel the car is almost way to easy to stop under braking. It feels like ABS is always on, even though I don't use the Driving Aids. Wet weather conditions will make any racer nervous to stray off the racing line to attack, as you will most likely end up in the gravel.DAMAGE: This is one big letdown. The damage model of the car is virtually unchanged, while it may be easier to clip your front wing, its taken a backwards step compared to other games like Project Cars, rFactor 2, Asseto Corsa. Even their own DIRT Rally has a better damage model and it was released before F1 2015. There seem to be NO MECHANICAL FAILURES, like brakes, ERS failure, flat spots and the only time i get a puncture is if I deliberatly punt the car into the wall hard enough.AI: The AI have been reworked as well, I play on legendary settings and they seem to manage their tyres better while still keeping up with me, often performing better. I tried some tyre savings but dropped off the pace, may have to change my tactics. AI like to make mistakes, sometimes clashing with each other and losing a front wing but nothing special compared to f1 2013. Another thing is if an AI hit you (yes HIT YOU) they tend to push your car into the wall, or spin you, while they continue as if there was no contact.REPLAYS/FLASHBACKS: Replays now allow you to see the action from not just your car, but any car you wish so you can see just how awesome that crash was. However the replays are slighty broken as once you perform a flashback you cant go back and rewind further. This made me lose a race as while overtaking a backmarker on the last lap I got hit and spun into a wall, as I used a flashback I hit the button too late and it flashbacked to after the spin and was unable to use the feature again to get out of it.SETUPS: Setups are ok, a few nicks from me, I cannot change a setup during a quick race with no practice and no qualifying. Or if it rains while the qualifying was dry on low downforce packs the AI seem to have a leading edge in the rain, almost like their setup changed. Funny that.In closing the game is the start of new things to come, it has bugs, its not feature full but its a good start of the Next Gen series. Compared to Dirt Rally (the sister game released prior) it feels like the F1 games don't get the development they need to be a great game for racers and feels unfinished. I still recommend this game however.

content:
y 13, 2016
												Τα βήματα που γίνανε προς τη σωστή κατεύθυνση είναι πολλά κι ορισμένα εξ’ αυτών πολύ σημαντικά. Αν η Codemasters δε προβεί σε νέους πειραματισμούς στους τομείς που διόρθωσε, αποφασίσει να λύσει κάποια άλλα προβλήματα που είναι χρόνια και ταυτόχρονα κατανοήσει ότι το έξτρα περιεχόμενο που έχει απ’ την εποχή F1 2010-F1 2014  (Career mode, Practice objectives, Classic mode, Diamond races, Champions mode, αλλά και οι προηγούμενες πίστες  σε Hockenheim, Valencia, Nurburgring, India, Korea, Instanbul) πρέπει να επιστρέψει στο παιχνίδι, έχει τα φόντα να μας δώσει του χρόνου έναν πλήρη εξομοιωτή F1. Μέχρι τότε το F1 2015 θα συντηρεί τις ελπίδες μας για κάτι τέτοιο, όντας ένα σημαντικά βελτιωμένο κεφάλαιο της σειράς.The visual and driving improvements, compared to F1 2014, are more than obvious, but the game still lacks some crucial aspects, such as safety car, smart penalty system and more aggressive and intelligent behaviour for drivers controlled by CPU. Also, all the content and the ideas that Codemasters already has in its hands from previous instalments (Career mode, Practice objectives, Classic mode, Diamond races, Champions mode and previous circuits, such as Hockenheim, Valencia, Nurburgring, India, Korea, Instanbul) must make their return in F1 2016.http://ragequit.gr/reviews/item/f1-2015-pc-reviewIf somebody from Codemasters is reading this, I would personally suggest the following changes in F1 2016:- Return of all modes I mentioned above- Return of all circuits I mentioned above, in one more special mode- Further improvement of the penalty system, especially regarding corner cutting- Enhanced possibility of mechanical failures or tyre punctures - Safety car and red flags please!- Better drivers' A.I, with more aggressive behaviour- Fixes on various smaller problems and lacks, such as the inability to change to option or prime tyres when rain stops during qualifying, better replay menus and controls, existence of a race calendar containing results from each race, fix on framedrops during Monza race- Instant ban to people behaving unacceptably in online multiplayer mode  I believe if you make all these changes in F1 2016, it will be truly epic!

content:
2, 2015
												After a bad start when F1 2015 was released, i genuinely thought i'd wasted my money getting the game. Now though, after all mthe updates that have been implemented to the game, my perspective has completely changed. More challenging, realistic, fun and competitive compared to the previous F1 releases. Codemasters had done a fantastic job with f1 2010 through to 2013, 2014 let them down a bit as the final game appeared to be just a car/sound update of 2013. There are still areas of the game that need improving: parc ferme needs fixing so that tyres used in Q2 are locked for the race start unless its alternate weather, own use of ERS was promised by codies but so far hasn't appeared. Also, multiplayer still doesn't support a full compliment of 20 human racers, still the 16 from the previous titles.Lets hope Codies can improve upon the current situation, but overall a good start for their first next gen F1 project.Rating 7/10

												I really love racing sim and I was really excited about this free weekend...Unfortunately this game is sort of broken and that ruins what could be really awesome.+ Great physics, feels really nice. Although I've never driven an F1 car I'd say it feels pretty "realistic"+ Graphics are pretty good+ Easy to turn all assists off and jump into sim mode really quickly- Draw distance on mirrors is abyssmal- Volume is far to loud even on lowest- Hard and higher difficulty A.I. will literally PLOW YOU OUT OF THE WAY ruining the game at these levels- You get penalties for any collisions even if the A.I. are completely at fault for the accident (I.E. plowing you out of the way from behind)- Performance is TERRIBLE. i5-3450 + GTX 960 4GB + 12GB of RAM on my system, and this game runs at 45fps most of the time on highest settings (1080p), comparatively Dirt Rally looks better and runs at 80 at max settings/1080p.Twenty dollars is far too much for this, maybe ten if it really goes on sale would be worth it, nothing more.

At the moment I'm using 360 and it's not perfect, but sort of okay. Then about that force feedback, it's just terrible again. It just doesn't communicate what the car is doing and just feel terrible and  no road. how am I suppose to race with that?!? AIso AI crashed into me a bunch of time in the short time I've played the game.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 2, 2016
												I bought this racing sim/game recently and love it.  I'm only about 7-hours into it, but wow, great job with this release.  I just ignored all the negative reviews and jumped right in, knowing most of the negatives were prior to the many patches and fixes. My intorduction to 2015 was after all the new release hoopla and problems (just purchased 01/30/2016), and long after the patches and bug fixes were released, so I do not and have not suffered from all the issues you see in reviews that are 1-6 months old.   Also it's smooth as silk running at max settings with 1920x1080 resolution AMD 8320 8-core.  I have 2014 as well and have fully enjoyed that on the PS3 and also just bought it for my PC, adding some nice graphic mods - 2014 is great looking in it's own right but with the new visual mods it's fantastic and with very cool game play options.  With that said, 2015 looks a little better but not a huge leap from 2014 imo, especially with visual mods added to 2014 - but 2015 looks better non-the-less unmoddd thus far.  The one thing is I don't see MSAA antialiasing, which is weird that 2015 wouldn't have that setting.Now the car and handling are much improved (ie harder to drive) with much better physics over 2014.  Need a very light touch on throttle and brakes or you'll feel like your driving on an ice rink (I only use medium TC assist, nothing else).  You have to finess the car handling and acceleration if you want to keep from crashing.  The first impression is the very real sensation and "feel" of driving the real thing; a highly unstable and fast F-1 racer - much much moreso than 2014.  After driving 2015 for a several hours with practice laps/time trials, I jumped into 2014 and with all assists off it was almost easy and a little "rail like".  After all the difficulty I have with pushing the new 2015 platform it makes jumping into 2014 a much easier drive.  The actual feeling of driving in 2015 is there in all it's glory, muchmoreso than 2014, and '14 is no slouch imo (I know the iRacing guys will probably laugh).  So I'll do most of my heavy practicing in 2015 and use 2014 to race online and for it's neat carreer mode and vintage racers.  And the audio in 2015....wow, that is something I noticed immediatly...so much fuller, louder, rich and deep.  The car and engine audio is leaps and bounds above 2014, very immersive.  The car, it simply screams!!I've not done any career races or online racing yet in 2015, so not sure about the AI or how well career mode is.  I do know you drive as a real driver, not as yourself, which is odd to me.  The career mode in 2014 is pretty cool, you get to do well and sign with better teams.  Not so with 2015 which is a dissapointment - oh well.  As for multiplayer, I guess there are still issues with the netcode for 2015 so it seems as of right now most of the online F1 leagues are racing with 2014 until Codeies fix 2015 multiplayer - hopefully soon.All in all I'm loving it so far.  Not that deep into it yet, but I'm working on it.  I'd definately recomend it.  I just don't see where all the hate is coming from as I don't see anything that would merit it at all in its current state.  I assume alot of it comes from the pre patch versions, but who knows.  Expectations can get out of control I guess.EDIT:  Oh, one thing - no trackIR support for 2015 far as I can tell.  It works for 2014, but can't get it to function in 2015.  My $.02 worth!  Good day,DrDetroit

												F1 2015 is not a really bad game. It's not even quite a bad game, it's just I'm not going to touch it for a couple years from now at least most likely and despite the price tag being still the original, it gets eclipsed by F1 2015 in pretty much every single way. If you bought it in the year it came out, then good on you, I'd say it'd only be a waste of your money if you bought it non-sale and a more than a month after release. Now, if you don't have it, only buy it if we're 3+ years in the future and it costs a fiver or less in the sales.It's not even any easier to run than F1 2016 in my experience at least.Pros:Realistic and rewarding handling modelGreat graphicsGood AIDebutised the pleasant 'broadcast presentation' and podiumsCons:Glitchy (Not so much now, but it was basically a techdemo on release)Impossible to be smooth on a padFacesOnline system (a mess of hoppers)Online lagThings it does better than it's little brother:Handling model questionably (but they are rather similiar in truth)Overall, my opinion is, BUY IT when it's really cheap, but there's no point at this moment in getting it.

												Five races into the season and this game is absolutely boring. It's repetitive as any racing game but it offers no incentive to play any further. Why play another 4 hours just to see 20 seconds of a "you won the championship" movie? You can fail objectives without punishment. The animations after sessions are always the same and though the in game models are nicely modeled, the menu pictures of drivers and cars are just heinous.The real gameplay is a conundrum: dynamic weather, flag rules, different performances all make for a great set up but driving feels wooden (especially on straights). I played without assistances (other than race line) and it doesn't take too long for you to master your car and catch Hamilton in every darn race. Different modes? You can play your usual short races through a season or go for the PRO SEASON (full length). Quick race, time trial, multiplayer. No legends, no career mode....It's no arcady enough for people who just want to hold the acceleration button down and it's too daft and simple for people who want a racing game.

												First F1 game i have purchased since geoff crammonds grand prix on Amiga.I bought this without reading reviews on strength of Dirt Rally performance on my PC.7850k and R9 280 16gig2133 ram.Avg more 60fps with good settings.Handles great ;really nice driving physics,proper good feedback .Wheel works fantastic.Looks great,honestly,i thought Dirt Rally was sexy;this is smashing.Great camera adjustment POV also adjustable.AI drivers just a bit annoying,just now and again you get rear ended by the ai,sometimes you see em,sometimes you dont.Not a game breaker for me;I'm sure Codemasters will tweak it.Sound is also very good,i use a sound card by creative,which helps to not hog the cpu with extra work.So smashing performance on my modest machine.Not crashed or locked up once.I like it,going to give some time up for it.Well i would if elite dangerous had not got its claws in me at the mo.

ry 4, 2016
												This came out with tons of bug, so I waited and bought it on a sale after a few patches. Now I must say the game runs like a charm in my system, I've found zero bugs.I run it on a i5 4440 with a 970GTX, 8GB of RAM, a SSD, Windows 10 and a 360 controller. Never had a crash, fps tank, controller issue or any other bug. Runs well and always at 60fps.The game is great. Good graphics and amazing AI. Good balance between arcade and simulator. For me is the most engaging racing game that I've tried, I love it.The damage system is pretty basic, and there is no safety car :( which it's my main concern with the game. There is no career mode, and while I miss that it's not the end of the world. They say the multiplayer is a mess, I don't know, never tried it. I'm always racing the AI.If you buy this game try it right away, in case you find bugs or issues and need to ask for a refund. But if you're lucky and the game runs well, then you'll find it worthy of your money.

												I dont get all that negativity for this game,sure its still little bugfest but thats vhere bad thins end(and if you want stupid and unrealistic 7 year long career mode,just go and play games like Need for speed for kids,this is Formula one game and what you got is chapionship in one season(or two in this game sience you get F1 2014 as well) like always before in Formula one games).I am something like veteran Formula one game player on PC ,i start with legendary Grand prix 2(and then GP3 and GP4,and also EA Formula one series)and ofcourse i play all recent F1 games from Codies,and to be honest i dont like those games that much ,mainly physics in those games feels bad,too arcady cars act like they have no weight etc.So i find my self very curious about new physics engine in F1 2015.After two days with this game i am more than happy with F1 2015,the physics is finally what i want you just feel the weight of the car much more and driving even with gamepad is fun and at the same time very challenging as you try handle all those torgues from hybrid engine(it feels to me like GP3 with traction control OFF).Next thing is much better graphics than before,in some cases(try night race at Singapore with heavy rain)is just absoluttely jawdropping,but with that said the optimization of this engine is just great(if you have something like cheap mainstream GPU like r9 270 ,GTX760 or GTX960 you can play this game wit 1080p high sets with stable 60fps  without any drops even in thunder storm(am look at you project CARS(-;).Next is sounds which are also very good,and finally the much better Ai that feels much more agressive than before and act like real drivers.All and all i am very impressed with F1 2015 and i have strong statement for you....this game is by far best Formula 1 game on PC i played the atmosfere is sometimes just stunning!!!.If you are heart beat fan of Formula one and racing games dont wait and buy it,you wont be dissapoited.

content:
0, 2015
												F1 2015 is a great F1 game but it needs sometime to fix it's crashes & gliches but atleast it runs great with all of my hardware. As of gameplay standpoint there is alot of changes like no career mode what is sad & the only  modes are "Championchip mode" what is just pick a team & driver, 5 race defaults (no customation of the race settings & hit the track, the other mode is "Pro Season" is just A full SIM Mode so if you are very good with driving go for it. As for the AI they are so much "lifely" & racing is so much better then before. btw is a switch for 2014 season mode as well, kinda cool addon, I quess. For those who enjoyed the online CO-OP, I am afraid there isn't the option to do that anymore but even if there was a online CO-OP your time with it probably would not be that cool with the onlines "netcode" atm.For the driving they have changed the pad turning "reaction" so you need to get a new grip for that if you are a pad user, the backend is pretty lose if you aren't carefull with your throttle & brakes are lot more realistic, I had to change almost all of my breaking points.  Conclusion:Wait if you aren't so big into F1 games but still wan't to play them for those who love F1 games go for it if you can life without a career mode and online is what it is. Force feedback is okey with me, not the best but ain't the worst either (G25). Good:Better grafics, The scenery behind tracks IS SO MUCH BETTERBetter Physics (with some funky crashes)Better replay systemBetter AITwo season's 2014 & 2015TV format (I like it)The Bad:Crashes & alot of gliches (prob going to be resolved)No career modeNo CO-OPOnline is still has same problems as older F1 gamesSC or VSC not present

content:
2, 2015
												Its not a bad game but it has problems:Its too difficult for casual play - cars speed away from you even on very easy setting. And this is ona  straight so its no reflection of the quality of the driving. There no way they should do that on an easy setting.Controller setting are minimal. Its ok if you have an 'advanced wheel' (whatever one of those is) but I have a joystick and you cant config it at all. No sensitivity settings for travelling at speed so you waver all over the track. Plus the game when I played it kept losing my controller settings every time I restarted. Also when I set the controller to joystick I couldnt use Esc to exit a session the only way to get out of a session was to stop on a racetrack and get black listed! You cant even exit from the pits. Terrible settings, terrible configuration.The car AI is abysmal. They dont go around you they barge you off the track every time. Otherwise its not a bad game, graphics are good, I had no crashes in the short time I was trying the game, pits looked good, communications with the team were really good. And of course this is probably the only game where you can play the current season without mods. In the end I used Steam refund policy to try the game and ended up getting a refund and bought Project Cars which is a far far far better game all around. But even rFactor2 is better than this game in terms of options, immersion, AI and driving experience.

												No idea why its reviewed so badly, the launch of the game had a pre-release tag on it, and included few major bugs and glitches, that's probably a part why its reviewed so badly if u buy a pre-release game you have to accept the fact that there might be some bugs and glitches still there. content:
6, 2015
												Purchased after the most recent patch. There are still some minor graphical glitches such as the back right tire flickering in and out in certain view modes but overall this game is very good now. The graphics and handling are much improved and really are quite ridiculous when you turn them all the way up. You get a good feel for how your cars handling changes as the race progresses and all of the modes are pretty accessible, (I have not tried the very hard pro mode yet). I would recommend getting a steering wheel for this game as it is difficult to play with anything else. I do have a fairly new gaming setup so keep that in mind when considering my review.Graphics- 8/10 would be 10/10 if there were not the minor annoying glitchesGame Modes- 7/10 fairly typical for a racing game but its tried and trueNew Handling System- 10/10 i really enjoy this aspect and its a big improvement from 2013 which is the last F1 game I played

												Well I'm a huge F1 fan so my opinion on this game is gunna be biased but this is probably the best F1 game Codemasters have made. The AI actually fight you and go for overtakes and do crash into others and you WHICH is realistic but makes everyone rage. The graphics are beautiful and I like the 2014 content really but it seems less worked on. The online actually does work I've raced against other people and they are actually good. Cars are realistic, fun and hard to drive.Bad stuff though: No safety car. Add this Codemasters in next update or explain why it's not in the game. No Career but I understand why Codemasters killed it to help with the license. Can be glitchy. It forgets my steerign wheel controls even though they're saved under custom. Legend AI are too easy won 17 races as Daniel Ricciardo. And the skins of cars are wrong at some tracks e.g. McLaren new dark and red livery wasn't on the car until Spain I think so I shouldn't be able to have it until Spain afterwards.Overall I'd say 8/10 haven't got any problems with it. Recommed to buy in a sale when there's more updates.

content:
15, 2016
												I got it on sale for half price and would be really dissatified if I paid full price. At half price I'm "Meh" on it at this time. So far I can't even get through a "quick race" without being pit manuvered by another car placing me at the back of the pack per race. That's gets pretty boring to constanly have happen. I have F1 2013 and been using it for like four monts also iRacing(bought direct from their site) for the same amount of time have a T-100(yeah entry level but affordable fun) so not like I'm brand new to FFB racing. F1 2013 I do take 1st place now and then Intermediate most assists off so also not a pro(to keep things clear). F1 2015 if tapped by another car you might as well just start the session over if you are trying to just get in the top ten for points let alone a podium stance. Wont happen. Slight tap and your into the gravel, a wall, other cars, time penalty, black flag(nice band bad for racing though lol). Ding time trials is pretty good though. Great graphics. The crew engineer is sort of nasty though. The feeling of the handling of the cars is better then F1 2013 IMO more realistic to the reality thing(no I haven't driven a actual Formula car, have had real cars that I wrenched on to make handling and all the rest better for racing so compared to those. One was full race suspension and steering, engine was mid rally. Boy does the auto insurance go way up scheezz!!!). I read all the bad reviews before buying 2015 but at half off I took a chance. I'm very boarder-line on recommend and not recommend but went with not because I just now once again got pit maneuvered into 17th place on the last turn of Monza after holding 1st place the rest of the race. I'll have to say I don't like doing reviews that are bad but after what just happened go figure. Besides, other people will have voiced my opinion already and much more eloquently too.
